name: Assam Golden Tips
description: This tea consists solely of pure golden tips, resulting in a lighter and sweeter flavor compared to most Assams. It is lightly rolled to preserve the tips. With this technique, there is limited oxidation, making the tea less brisk. Natural sweetness in this tea comes from the tips (or the buds) because the plants send extra sugars there to make more leaves. Mokalbari Tea Estate has exclusively provided our 2026 supply of Assam Golden Tips at our request.

name: Khongea Broken
description: A bold, brisk Assam. Great for starting your mornings off right! This tea is produced by the Prakash family of DLX Ltd., who also own Glenburn Tea Estate. It is made on the south side of the Brahmaputra River in India.

name: Artisanal Qi Men Town
description: The Fang family has been making Keemun in Qi Men Town for three generations. We love this handmade version of Hao Ya ‘A’ Keemun.

name: 2005 Imperial Gold Tip Pu-Erh
description: This tea is a "ripe" or shou Pu-Erh variety sourced from Xishuangbanna in Yunnan, China. The term "shou" describes a method that accelerates the aging process down to a few months. After its initial fast aging process, this tea has been slowly aging for over 20 years. Like a bottle of fine wine, it is mellow and delicious. We break the large cakes (bings) into more manageable chunks.

name: Love Always, Bag of 25 Sachets
description:
Love Always is our romantic brew of our Chocolate Black Tea blend with lovely pink rosebuds. Keep the romance alive and enjoy this special tea with your special someone throughout the year.
Each bag contains 25 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.This tea is also known as Valentine's Day.

name: Best Sellers – 4 Bags of 50 Sachet Bundle
description: Experience the finest of teas with our Best Sellers Bulk Bundle. Indulge in the bold, delicious flavors of our #1 seller, Hot Cinnamon Spice, and the mild yet complex bouquet of Paris. Delight in the intense sophistication of Earl Grey Supreme, and the full-bodied richness of English Breakfast. Get all four and save with our bulk bundle, the ultimate way to savor luxury tea.

name: Heirloom Tea Chest Featuring Nine Teas – Teabags
description:
Etched with our Harney & Sons logo and crafted to exquisiteness, this beautiful bamboo wooden tea chest with black accents makes an elegant and delectable addition to any tea-drinker's arsenal. We've filled each chest with nine of our favorite teas, each variety carefully selected to appease every thirst. A total of 90 individually wrapped teabags per chest—just right for brewing up a pot to enjoy with friends or savoring yourself over time.
Each chest contains:

 

90 - Teabags (9 flavors, 10 of each flavor, pre-selected from our Foil-Wrapped Teabag Collection).

name: Strawberry Vanilla
description: A delightful blend of black tea with fruity strawberry flavors melded with creamy vanilla flavors. This will get you ready for future strawberry shortcakes! A tantalizing treat for your taste buds.

name: Rou Gui Oolong
description: It is a pleasure again to offer Rou Gui. We love the roasted fruit flavors that come out of this oolong. The Wuyi Mountains of Fujian in China, the same location as Da Hong Pao, are the source of this tea. The cinnamon notes are naturally occurring parts of this tea plant. The Chen family, a 3rd generation family of tea makers, harvested and offered this year's crop.

name: Meijiawu Lung Ching
description:
Lung Ching is to Chinese green teas what French Champagne is to sparkling wines: the standard against which all others are measured. With almost no tips, it has the classic Chinese green tea qualities of steamed bok choy and roasted nuts. 
This is from one of the four original locations outside of Hangzhou. We have bought from Mr. Zhao for years, so you can count on this being the real tea.

name: Yuzu Sencha
description:
Yuzu appears to be experiencing a surge in popularity. This beloved Japanese citrus is prized for its bright, aromatic character, somewhere between lemon and grapefruit. When we came across this offering pairing fragrant yuzu with classic Japanese sencha, we were instantly intrigued.
The fresh, grassy notes of sencha provide the perfect canvas for Yuzu’s lively citrus lift. The result is a cup that feels clean, refreshing, and beautifully balanced. It’s an easygoing green tea with a modern twist, equally enjoyable hot or iced, and a wonderful introduction to one of Japan’s most exciting flavors.

name: Historic Royal Palaces Tea Set
description:
Historic Royal Palaces is an independent charity that looks after the Tower of London, Hampton Court Palace, the Banqueting House, Kensington Palace, and Hillsborough Castle and Gardens.
Each set includes:
1 - Historic Royal Palaces Teapot1 - Historic Royal Palaces Creamer1 - Historic Royal Palaces Sugar Bowl1 - Royal Palace Tea, HRP Tin of 30 SachetsYour choice of two, four, or six Historic Royal Palaces Teacups & Saucers

name: Bamboo Heirloom Tea Chest Featuring Eight Teas – Wrapped Sachets
description:
Etched with our Harney & Sons logo and crafted to exquisiteness, this beautiful bamboo wooden tea chest with black accents makes an elegant and delectable addition to any tea-drinker's arsenal. We've filled each chest with eight of our favorite teas, each variety carefully selected to appease every thirst. A total of 32 individually wrapped sachets per chest—just right for brewing up a pot to enjoy with friends or savoring yourself over time.
Each chest contains:

32 - Sachets (8 flavors, 4 of each flavor, pre-selected from our Individually Wrapped Sachet Collection).

name: Traditional Ti Quan Yin
description:
Ti Quan Yin, also known as the Iron Goddess of Mercy, is one of China's most famous teas. China is known for its greenish, rolled oolongs. Traditionally, men using their feet and body weight would roll these oolongs into tight balls in something like a pillowcase. Lastly, they dried the tea over smoldering charcoal. 
These days, machines are used to slowly roll the tea in pillowcases, making balls of oolong tea. This tea has been finished over charcoal, so it has a toasty flavor.

name: Golden Genmaicha
description: People love Genmaicha, that blend of tea and roasted brown rice. So we decided to give you one more choice. This version is with Hojicha (roasted tea stems) and roasted brown rice. A very nice blend that is also very low in caffeine.

name: Osmanthus Oolong
description: This is a traditional Oolong from Fujian Province in China. Osmanthus Oolong features dark notes of fruit and hints of flowers throughout. Smooth and elegant, this tea is light and fragrant—a perfect choice for a sophisticated afternoon tea. Re-steep the leaves to reveal further beautiful flavors and heavenly aromas.

name: Maruichi Select
description: Created in collaboration with Maruichi, a beloved collection of Japanese specialty food stores, this blend combines the elegance of Darjeeling black tea with the bright, aromatic lift of yuzu. Originally crafted as a custom request, the pairing was so harmonious and distinctive that we knew it deserved a permanent place in our collection. Delicate and citrus-kissed, this tea bridges cultures in every cup.

name: Stump Teapot with Infuser 18 oz (Multiple colors)
description:
ForLife Design's Stump Teapot remains one of our most popular teapot styles. With an 18 oz. capacity, it's just the right size to hold enough tea for a second cup. Complete with an extra-fine 0.3 mm stainless-steel tea infuser and permanently attached hinged lid for easy use. The extra-fine infuser enables you to steep fine loose-leaf teas like Rooibos to large whole-leaf teas like Oolongs. The stackable design allows you to save storage space, which is convenient for food-service uses such as tea rooms, cafés, bars, and restaurants.

Capacity: 18 oz.
Dishwasher-safe.
Dimensions (inches): 3.5h x 6.75w x 4.5d

name: Hot Cinnamon Tea Pods
description:
Our most popular flavored tea worldwide, Hot Cinnamon Spice, is an assertive blend of black teas, three types of cinnamon, orange peel, and sweet cloves, with no sugar added. This tea is also known as Hot Cinnamon Sunset. They are the same tea. The name varies only in certain packaging.
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Hot Cinnamon Spice.

name: English Breakfast Tea Pods
description:
A blend of Chinese black teas to start the morning off. Milk and sugar? Your call.
Click here to see additional purchasing options for English Breakfast.

name: Earl Grey Tea Pods
description:
This tea is perhaps the most famous tea in the world, originally inspired by the British Prime Minister, Earl Grey. There are as many different versions of Earl Grey as there are tea companies. Our popular blend uses tea from India and China, blended with natural oil of bergamot.
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Earl Grey.

name: Pemberley Grey, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Crafted in honor of the beloved BBC adaptation’s 30th anniversary, this refined blend of black tea, oolong tea, rose, bergamot, and bright grapefruit is a tea worthy of Pemberley Estate: elegant, complex, and unexpectedly romantic.
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!

name: Lunar New Year 2026 – Year of the Horse
description: Throughout Asia, during the Spring Festival, also known as the Lunar New Year, people welcome a change in season and what it brings: new beginnings. To honor that tradition, we created this tea blend inspired by Nian Gao, a delicacy made of caramel, sesame, and coconut enjoyed during the celebrations.

name: Yunnan Golden Tips
description: If Keemuns are the aristocrats of Chinese black teas, Yunnan black teas could be considered the frugal yet happy cousins from another region. Earthy and almost assertive, Yunnan teas have a maple sweetness that wins you over with charm. Typical of many Yunnan teas, Yunnan Golden Tips features a mixture of dull gold buds and black leaves (also known as Dianhong).

name: Ti Quan Yin Spring Floral
description: Ti Quan Yins are some of China's most famous teas. They are from Southern Fujian Province, and it was in these hills that teas were first rolled into small balls. That allowed the teas to slowly oxidize and slowly develop these great flavors.

name: Wuyi Da Hong Pao
description: Few places can boast as rich a crop of tea as China's Wuyi Mountains. From these famous tea fields comes this Da Hong Pao, or "Big Red Robe." The descendants of the three famous tea plants produce this wonderful oolong tea, their large, unbroken leaves roughly 40% oxidized for a warm and rich flavor. On the palate, notes of peach compote and dark molasses persist, with each steep producing a slightly different evolution of flavor.

name: Williamsburg Holiday Heritage Tea, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Bring home a taste of Colonial Williamsburg's grand illumination! A classic holiday tea with hints of citrus, cinnamon, and a dash of nostalgia. Your purchase of Williamsburg products supports the research, preservation, and educational programs of the non-profit Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Williamsburg Holiday Heritage Tea.

name: Cookies & Cream
description: When life crumbles, steep a little joy! A swirl of sweet vanilla and luxurious chocolate melts into a rich black tea base, creating a cup that’s part comforting treat and part nostalgic indulgence. Like a favorite cookie dunked into a mug, each sip is smooth, creamy, and delightfully crave-worthy. One sip and you’ll be saying, “I’ll never dessert you, tea.” It’s dunk-ably delightful, totally crave-worthy, and guaranteed to make your inner cookie monster crumble with happiness.

name: Served Vacuum Insulated Pitcher (Assorted Colors)
description:
Your drinks have never been better with Bean's vacuum-insulated, stainless steel, copper-lined, double-walled pitchers. What does all of that mean? It means your batch cocktails will not get watered down! Your drinks will stay cold (or hot) for hours, and the outside will stay cool and dry to the touch. The tight-fitting lid will keep your drink solidly inside until you're ready to share your creations.
Hand wash only.Not microwave, oven, or stove safe.

name: Supreme Matcha
description:
This matcha comes from the area around Uji, Japan. It is a blend from the second season, around June and July. This allows us to offer a nice matcha at a nice price. Mix this with your milk of choice, and you will have a supreme beverage.
Make sure to check out all our Matcha teas!

name: H&S Calendar Tea Towel 2026
description:
A calendar right at the tip of your teacup. This beautiful Le Jacquard Francais tea towel is made in France from pure cotton and embroidered with a calendar of the year, so you'll always know the day (the time, of course, is time for tea). 

Le Jacquard Francais Calendar Tea Towel 2026.
100% cotton. 
Made in France. 
Dimensions: 31 inches long x 24 inches wide.

name: Williamsburg Holiday Heritage Tea, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Bring home a taste of Colonial Williamsburg's grand illumination! A classic holiday tea with hints of citrus, cinnamon, and a dash of nostalgia. Your purchase of Williamsburg products supports the research, preservation, and educational programs of the non-profit Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

description:
When life crumbles, steep a little joy! A swirl of sweet vanilla and luxurious chocolate melts into a rich black tea base, creating a cup that’s part comforting treat and part nostalgic indulgence. Like a favorite cookie dunked into a mug, each sip is smooth, creamy, and delightfully crave-worthy. One sip and you’ll be saying, “I’ll never dessert you, tea.” It’s dunk-ably delightful, totally crave-worthy, and guaranteed to make your inner cookie monster crumble with happiness.

name: Harney & Sons Mug with Permanent Tea Filter Bundle
description: Enjoy the perfect cup of tea from start to finish with our specially priced Harney & Sons Mug with Permanent Tea Filter Bundle. This elegant duo pairs our Permanent Tea Filter, crafted from durable stainless steel for a clean, flavorful infusion, with our signature Harney & Sons Logo Mug, a timeless porcelain vessel designed for everyday indulgence. Together, they make steeping loose tea effortless and elegant.

name: Heartland Masala Chai
description: This unique chai blend, inspired by the recipe in Heartland Masala by Jyoti and Auyon Mukharji, pairs CTC Assam tea with an assertive blend of ginger, cinnamon, fennel, cardamom, clove, and black pepper. Jyoti and Auyon strongly recommend adding milk and sugar to taste.

name: Lunar New Year 2026 – Year of the Horse, Tin of 30 Sachets
description:
Throughout Asia, during the Spring Festival, also known as the Lunar New Year, people welcome a change in season and what it brings: new beginnings. To honor that tradition, we created this tea blend inspired by Nian Gao, a delicacy made of caramel, sesame, and coconut enjoyed during the celebrations.Each tin contains 30 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!
 Click here to see additional purchasing options for Lunar New Year.

name: Gingerbread Festival
description: Sweet, spicy, and full of holiday flavors, our Gingerbread Festival tea summons up the familiar tastes of old-fashioned gingerbread. We begin with a base of mild yet full-bodied black tea, then swirl in pieces of ginger root, cinnamon, and a touch of molasses flavor. A final layer of sweet vanilla flavor and spiced cloves finishes the brew for an easy-to-drink cup that sparkles with richness.

name: Gingerbread 20 MG Hemp, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Like traditional gingerbread houses, the flavors of cinnamon, ginger, and molasses swirl together with our homegrown Hemp Extract in this sweet and spicy blend.
Hemp: 20 mg per sachet.

Each tin contains 20 sachets.
Directions: Use 1 sachet per 12 oz. of water, up to 3x daily.
Caffeinated.

 


Ingredients: Black tea, ginger root, cinnamon, molasses flavor, vanilla flavor, cloves, Hemp Extract. Contains natural flavors.
*These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA (Food and Drug Administration). This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.
Please view The Hemp Division Certificates of Analysis here.

name: Decaffeinated Chai, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Our Decaf Chai delivers the bold, warming flavor you love with none of the caffeine. We start with smooth decaffeinated black tea and layer in a classic blend of chai spices: cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, and clove. Rich, aromatic, and deeply comforting, it’s the perfect choice for winding down or sipping any time of day.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see our caffeinated Chai.

name: Spearmint Black, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
This refreshing blend brings together smooth, full-bodied Chinese black tea and the crisp, cooling zing of spearmint leaves grown in Washington State. The result is a lively cup that balances the rich depth of black tea with the invigorating brightness of mint. Naturally caffeinated for a gentle boost.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

name: Horchata, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Paul's passion for all things Mexican inspired this blend of Milky Oolong, toasted rice, and cinnamon bark! Enjoy it served hot or over ice for a refreshing treat on a summer’s day! Feel free to add milk and sugar.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Looking for Horchata HT Tin of 20 Sachets? Click here.

name: Butterfly Pea Flower, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Butterfly Pea Flower has been used for centuries in Southeast Asia and has recently been introduced to tea drinkers outside of its native area of Thailand. The flower boasts a long list of Ayurvedic properties, and people love the bright blue color and the fact that it changes color to a nice purple color when some acid (like lemon juice) is added. The cup imparts a mild, earthy flavor. 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Please note: The mineral content of your water source will affect the color of the brew. Our photos use local spring water sourced from the Berkshires. If the color of your brew is different, please consider trying an alternative water source. 
 Click here to see additional purchasing options for Butterfly Pea Flower.

name: Scottish Morn & Afternoon Lover Bundle
description: Treat yourself or a loved one to the sophisticated pleasure of a Scottish Morn & Afternoon Lover Bundle. Experience the bold blend of Scottish Morn to kickstart your day and savor the full-bodied flavor of Scottish Afternoon to guide you through the second half. Let this bundle of luxury be your daily reminder to slow down and appreciate every moment. Contains a 50 CT Bag of each Scottish Morn and Scottish Afternoon.

name: Colombian Cocoa Kisses
description: The company Himalaya is located in Yumbo, Colombia, and has supplied us with black teas for several years. We are pleased to offer their latest blend of black tea and cacao kisses. Please note, there is no chocolate flavoring, so the chocolate flavor is more of a peck than a kiss!

name: Tea Scoop - Natural Horn
description:
Measure your tea in style with our natural horn scoop. The color of the scoop will vary from the photograph. No two are alike.

Dimension: 3.6 inches long.

name: Nepalese Shangrila
description: Emeric Harney visited the tea estates of Nepal a few years ago and we have been beefing up our offerings ever since. This is reminiscent of a nice Second Flush Darjeeling from neighboring India.

name: Hunan Wild
description: Years ago Elvira and Mike visited this remote and scenic area. While there, they visited an old tea garden that was overgrown with trees. They harvest the wild tea plants there. Wild tea is a bit lighter since the plants are not cared for, but they produce unusual and wonderful flavors not found in tea grown in regular rows.

name: Berry Cobbler, Tin of 20 Sachets
description: The winner of our 2022 Happy Blendings contest! This blend starts with a mellow-bodied herbal base, then layers in blueberry, raspberry, vanilla, and cinnamon. All that's missing is the ice cream.

name: Hainan Black
description: Off the southern coast of China is an island named Hainan. Generally, it is not known for its tea. However, our colleague in China, VeeVee, finds many artisanal teas in her home country. She told us about this one. Now you can explore one of the best teas made on Hainan. We enjoyed its roasted fruit flavors.

name: Lay a Little Egg Tea Towel
description:
Long a customer favorite for their effortless charm and hardy construction, Sophie Allport products add a hint of levity and whimsy even to the most proper tea sets. Why not make your kitchen a little more fun with our Lay a Little Egg Tea Towel? Machine washable and 100% cotton, each tea towel features a handy loop that makes it easy to hang up or toss aside as needed—no unusably intricate wash directions here.

Dimensions (inches): 25.5l x 17.7w.

name: Thiele Silver
description: Our German tea connection, close family friend Marcus Wulf, has made this tea available. If you like the real deal strong East Friesian tea from the place in Germany that drinks the most of it, this is for you. Thiele Silver is stronger and more full-bodied than Thiele Gold. Also, we have purchased and are pleased to offer the traditional rock sugar that graces many a cup. Add some fresh cream, and you will think that you are in Bremen.

name: Thiele Gold
description: Our German tea connection, close family friend Marcus Wulf, has made this tea available. If you like the real deal strong East Friesian tea from the place in Germany that drinks the most of it, this is for you. Thiele Gold offers a more mellow experience, blending bold Assam and Ceylon teas with the more mellow Darjeeling tea. Also, we have purchased and are pleased to offer the traditional rock sugar that graces many a cup. Add some fresh cream, and you will think that you are in Bremen.

name: 2019 Shu Pu-Erh
description: This tea is a "ripe" or shou Pu-Erh variety sourced from Xishuangbanna in Yunnan, China. The term "shou" describes a method that accelerates the aging process. This tea comes from Brown Mountain and is made from ancient tea plants that make great bings, or cakes. We break the large cakes into more manageable chunks. Being a young tea, it is strong in flavor and body. Enjoy multiple brews of this tea.

name: Kathmandu
description: Kathmandu—just the name evokes misty mornings, terraced hillsides, and the hum of life winding through ancient streets. This beautiful tea from Nepal carries that same spirit, offering a cup that feels both familiar and adventurous. With large brown leaves, it brews an amber liquor that immediately greets you with notes of stone fruit layered over warm, roasted vegetable aromas. It reminds us a lot of a subdued Second Flush Darjeeling.

name: Organic Ginger Turmeric, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Organic Ginger Turmeric is a potent blend of two powerhouse roots that are sure to become a staple in your tea cabinet. We've added apple, beetroot, and lemongrass to bring an extra touch of flavor to this ruby-colored brew. Warm and soothing when brewed hot, and refreshing when served iced, you will find a sense of tranquility in every cup. Rejuvenate with this herbal infusion. Caffeine-free.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Organic Ginger Turmeric.

name: ForLife Mist Glass Iced Tea Jug, 68 oz (Assorted Colors)
description:
The Mist Iced Tea Jug is the perfect jug for making large amounts of iced tea. Simply fill the infuser with loose tea, fill the jug half way with hot water, steep, remove the tea leaves, and fill the rest of the jug with cold water. Serve over ice, and enjoy! Ideal for tea bags too!
Parts & Materials

Basket Infuser: Made of stainless steel and polypropylene. Condensed extra-fine holes to circulate the tea efficiently. Handle for easy access to control infusing time. Dishwasher-safe, BPA-free, and heat resistant up to  240°F/120°C.
Push-on lid: Made of stainless steel, ABS, and silicone. Attach and detach capability for easy cleaning. Dishwasher-safe, BPA-free, and heat resistant up to 240°F/120°C.

Pot: Made of borosilicate glass. Microwavable, hand-wash recommended, thermal shock resistant up to 240°F/120°C.
All the materials used for ForLife products are food safe.


Care Instructions & Warning

Use caution when handling hot water.
Let boiling water cool down a bit before pouring in into the jug.
Do not lift the pot by the push-on lid.

Do not place the pot directly on the heating element.
Press the push lever gently to open the lid.
Use baking soda dissolved in warm water to clean tea stains as needed.

name: Organic English Breakfast, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Organic Chinese Black tea from Keemun makes a smooth full-bodied brew of this traditional breakfast blend. 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

name: Organic Assam, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Our Organic Assam is a rich, full-leaf, medium-bodied black tea. It has a slightly lighter liquor with a sweet honey flavor.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Organic Assam.

name: Victorian London Fog Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
Victorian London Fog was the first winning blend in our customer creation contest! Thousands of blends were submitted, and we let you all choose between the top 5 flavors! The beverage called London Fog originated during the Victorian era. Traditionally, it is an Earl Grey served with steamed milk. 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Victorian London Fog.

name: Peppermint Herbal Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
Our marvelously brisk Peppermint comes from Washington State, and the leaves produce a wonderfully aromatic and crisp-tasting tisane. We find a cup of Peppermint can also get a pesky stomach under control in no time.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Peppermint Herbal.

name: Dragon Pearl Jasmine Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
A masterpiece from Fuan, China, Dragon Pearl Jasmine is comprised of little, hand-rolled 'pearls' gently infused with jasmine flowers. The blend is pure joy, with the floral and sweet aromas of the light-colored brew.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Dragon Pearl Jasmine.

name: Decaf Hot Cinnamon Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
We're happy to provide a decaffeinated rendition of our best-seller: Hot Cinnamon Spice. It features the same assertive flavors: three types of cinnamon, orange peel, and sweet cloves, with the decaf black tea base. Despite the allure, there is no sugar or added sweeteners. Enjoy it anytime!
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Decaf Hot Cinnamon.

name: Paris Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
Mike Harney has enjoyed many a pot of tea in the famous Parisian tea shops. In homage to the city, he created what's become one of Harney & Sons' most popular and beloved blends worldwide. Paris is a fruity black tea with vanilla and caramel flavors and a hint of lemony bergamot. The aroma is delightful!
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Paris.

name: English Breakfast Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
There are many versions of English Breakfast tea. Ours has an ancient pedigree. Researchers have traced its heritage back to the black tea the English drank regularly in the 1800's. It is, simply, China black 100% Keemun. A simple way to start your hectic day! 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
 Click here to see additional purchasing options for English Breakfast.

name: Earl Grey Supreme Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
For the connoisseur, we offer Earl Grey Supreme, which uses a higher grade of tea with the addition of silver tips. Most of our customers never go back to our regular Earl Grey once they taste the Supreme. If you love bergamot and fine tea, this is the blend for you! 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Earl Grey Supreme.

name: Hot Cinnamon Spice Trio – 3 Bags of 50 Sachets
description:
Our most popular flavored tea worldwide, Hot Cinnamon Spice, is an assertive blend of black teas, three types of cinnamon, orange peel, and sweet cloves, with no sugar added. This tea is also known as Hot Cinnamon Sunset. They are the same tea. The name varies only in certain packaging.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Hot Cinnamon Spice.

name: Hibiscus, Box of 20 Premium Teabags
description:
Wait patiently as you brew your hibiscus tea and you will be rewarded with the tangiest of flavors and a rich, deep crimson liquid. 
There is something very special about this tart herbal infusion which comes from the hibiscus plant, known for its large, showy, vibrant flowers, and exotic feel. With sharp notes of citrus and a floral sweetness, hibiscus tea is a caffeine-free way to keep warm through chilly months. Equally, if summer temperatures become too much to bear, serve over ice for a sharp, refreshing treat that is visually stunning with it's ruby hues. 
Each box contains 20 teabags.Each teabag brews one 6-8 oz. cup of tea.Each teabag is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!

name: Strawberry Vanilla, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
A delightful blend of black tea with fruity strawberry flavors melded with creamy vanilla flavors. This will get you ready for future strawberry shortcakes! A tantalizing treat for your taste buds.
Each HT tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!

name: Mayfair Breakfast, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
We are proud to be the tea blenders for some of London's luxury 5-star hotels. Through our relationships, we have learned the taste preferences of the British. We know they like their tea strong, and indeed, this one is! An English-style English Breakfast tea, Mayfair Breakfast, is made to be served with milk and sugar.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

name: Botanical Blend Earl Grey, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
This calming blend with a delicate floral hint evokes the silky blooms in John Singer Sargent's masterful painting of the Wyndham sisters lounging in the luxurious family drawing room of their residence on London's Belgrave Square.
Click here to explore The Met Collection.

name: Harney & Sons Scented Candle (Assorted Scents)
description:
One of the most unique and memorable aspects of enjoying tea is the aroma as it infuses. Taking inspiration from their favorite teas, Brigitte and Emeric Harney created this collection of candles that we are excited to present to you.
Black Tea is crafted with notes of honey, vanilla, and bourbon. Green Tea features the vibrant green aromas of fern, honeysuckle, and cucumber. 
Please note: Candles are a soy blend and have an approximate burn time of 45 hours.

name: Ahimsa Tea, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Ahimsa is an aspiring tea. Named for the ethical principle of not causing harm to other living things, it invites you to join in a worldwide revolution of peace, sponsored by the Humanity Initiative. This invigorating blend is made with Organic Rooibos, cinnamon, and hibiscus. 50% of sales go towards the Humanity Initiative. Please visit www.infusionsofpeace.org for information on how to join in this necessary revolution of peace. 
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!
Click here to see all our Rooibos teas.

name: Horchata, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Paul's passion for all things Mexican inspired this blend of Milky Oolong, toasted rice, and cinnamon bark! You will be met with a mysterious and slightly spicy aroma and if you add milk and sugar, a tea reminiscent of porcelain that complements its gilt-edged tea caddy to perfection. Enjoy it served hot or over ice for a refreshing treat on a summer’s day! Feel free to add milk and sugar.
Each HT tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!

Looking for Horchata Bag of 50 Sachets? Click here.

name: Paris, Box of 20 Premium Teabags
description:
Mike Harney has enjoyed many a pot of tea in the famous Parisian tea shops. In homage to the city, he created what's become one of Harney & Sons' most popular and beloved blends worldwide. Paris is a fruity black tea with vanilla and caramel flavors and a hint of lemony bergamot. The aroma is delightful!
Each box contains 20 teabags.Each teabag brews one 6-8 oz. cup of tea.Each teabag is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Paris.

name: Snow White, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Disney’s Snow White, a live-action musical reimagining of the classic 1937 film, opens exclusively in theaters March 21, 2025. Starring Rachel Zegler (West Side Story) in the title role and Gal Gadot (Wonder Woman) as her Stepmother, the Evil Queen, the magical music adventure journeys back to the timeless story with beloved characters Bashful, Doc, Dopey, Grumpy, Happy, Sleepy, and Sneezy.  Disney’s Snow White is directed by Marc Webb (The Amazing Spider-Man) and produced by Marc Platt (The Little Mermaid) and Jared LeBoff (The Girl on the Train), with Callum M Dougall (Mary Poppins Returns) serving as executive producer, and features all-new original songs from Benj Pasek and Justin Paul (Dear Evan Hansen).
We loved creating Disney’s Snow White Blend, starting with a Mutan White tea base then adding apple pieces (not sourced from a wicked queen), apple flavor, cornflowers, and marigolds that reminded us of Snow White in a cottage with her forest animal friends. It may just be the tastiest tea of the land!
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!

Click here to see all our Flavored White Teas.

©2025 Disney

name: Fujian Black
description: This tea comes from southern Fujian Province, China. In contrast to Zhang Ping Black (which comes from the same area), the flavor is more intense and slightly different, edging toward vanilla.

name: Harney & Sons Logo Tasting Cup Set
description:
Perfect for tea enthusiasts and professionals alike, our 3-piece logo tasting set is a staple in traditional tea cupping sessions. Designed with practicality, these sets are essential for evaluating the flavor profiles of teas with ease.
Featuring a sleek design and adorned with the Harney & Sons logo, the set includes a steeping cup, strainer lid, and tasting bowl. Its functional design allows you to infuse teas simply, and with a quick flip of the cup, the strainer lid effortlessly separates the tea leaves, leaving you with a clean infusion ready to savor.
Ideal for brewing, tasting, and exploring the nuances of every tea leaf, this set is a must-have for tea connoisseurs who value tradition and elegance in every sip.

Capacity: 4 oz.
Dishwasher-safe.
Microwave-safe.

name: Strawberry Milkshake, Tin of 30 Sachets
description:
Strawberry Milkshake is a whimsical blend that captures the creamy nostalgia of your favorite diner treat, without the calories! This oolong tea is infused with the lush sweetness of strawberries, the smooth richness of milk flavor, and a hint of vanilla, creating a velvety-smooth brew that feels like dessert in a cup. Perfect for those moments when you crave something indulgent yet light.
Each tin contains 30 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!

name: Hibiscus, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Hibiscus tea offers a vibrant, tangy flavor with a deep crimson hue. Known for its refreshing tartness and natural floral sweetness, this caffeine-free infusion is perfect hot or iced.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

name: Hibiscus
description:
Wait patiently as you brew your hibiscus tea and you will be rewarded with the tangiest of flavors and a rich, deep crimson liquid. 
There is something very special about this tart herbal infusion which comes from the hibiscus plant, known for its large, showy, vibrant flowers, and exotic feel. With sharp notes of citrus and a floral sweetness, hibiscus tea is a caffeine-free way to keep warm through chilly months. Equally, if summer temperatures become too much to bear, serve over ice for a sharp, refreshing treat that is visually stunning with it's ruby hues.

name: Himalayan Bouquet
description: Jun Chibaryi is an estate in remote Nepal, on the way to India. Emeric visited it years ago. They make lovely teas, and this is one of them. Lovely aromas and beautiful-looking tea—what is there not to like?

name: Ginger's Oolong, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
When we added ginger to our peachy and delicious Formosa Oolong, we couldn't believe our tastebuds. Ginger's Oolong, a fun and flavorful spin on our popular Peaches & Ginger tea, was created!
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Ginger's Oolong.

name: Williamsburg Pomegranate Garden, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
The latest addition to our Williamsburg Collection, Pomegranate Garden offers a level of sophistication blended with sweet and tart notes of pomegranate flavors and hibiscus. This highly prized, vivid floral pattern has graced homes since the 18th century. Inspired by Asian plants and Indian textiles, it included pomegranate and hibiscus. Popularly called “tobacco leaf” by collectors, it was a fashionable import to the American South as fine china.
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!

name: Williamsburg Earl Grey, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Enjoy a refined flavor profile with the essence of tradition in every sip. Bring home a tea as classic as our Arcadia Pattern. Vines and blooms are so elegant, you’ll want to showcase the lovely tin—a work of art in itself. This 18th-century design features the copperplate-printed look fashionable in France and England in the 1760s.

description:

The blend brings together the richness of black tea, the nutty warmth of toasted rice, and the delicate sweetness of red bean flavor and vanilla, creating a soothing, aromatic experience that honors the tradition of red bean confections across cultures.

name: Wellness in the Cup, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Wellness in the Schools is a national nonprofit that teaches children healthy habits to learn, live, and thrive. They partner with public schools, chefs, and coaches to ensure access to nourishing food and active play. Their collaborative approach and programming aim to shift the culture of schools to prioritize well-being. 
Founded in 2005 by Nancy Easton and Chef Bill Telepan, Wellness in the Schools reaches over one million public school students across the country every school day. We offer this blend as a nourishing alternative for a quick pick-me-up before or after school. A portion of the proceeds from each tin sold will go to benefit Wellness in the Schools.
Each tin contains 30 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!

name: Yerba Mate Licorice, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
In college, workdays, and beyond, there are times we have to burn the midnight oil, pull an allnighter, and find ourselves needing more caffeine than black tea yields. To keep everyone going stronger (and a bit longer), Mike created Yerba Mate Licorice, a blend of two highly caffeinated herbals, Yerba Mate and Guayusa, with a bit of licorice to make it taste great. Sure to stimulate you as you work the night away!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Yerba Mate Licorice.

name: Culinary Matcha
description:
Our Culinary Matcha, sourced from Japan, is the perfect addition to your baking and cooking. This culinary-grade matcha adds a delicate and flavorful touch to your dishes, elevating them to a new level of sophistication. Add something unique to your menu today by using our matcha in your culinary and libation creations.
Make sure to check out all our Matcha teas!

name: Harney & Sons: How to Read Tea Leaves
description: John Harney loved reading the tea leaves of family, friends, and customers alike.  Find love, fortune, and change with this 66-card deck and illustrated guidebook that teaches beginners how to read and interpret tea leaves. This card deck and guidebook set is perfect for guiding readers through the mystical art of tea leaf reading. John Harney himself, founder of Harney & Sons, loved this form of divination, and his grandchildren will attest that he was always happy to read for friends and strangers alike.Harney & Sons: How to Read Tea Leaves teaches the basics of tea leaf reading, the history behind the ancient practice, how to interpret and apply the symbols in your cup, and methods of conducting readings for yourself, friends, or family.This book’s dictionary of symbols is divided into six categories, each with a specific tea pairing, for readings of Love, Clarity, Success, Change, Omens, and Inspiration, to help you reveal hidden truths and gain spiritual insight into your life with every sip.

name: True Blue Oolong, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:

name: Agatha Christie Trio Gift Set
description:
When Harney & Sons started in 1983, no one had a clue we’d be asked to create not one, not two, but three blends that pay homage to one of the greatest mystery writers of all time, Agatha Christie. We were honored to put our "little grey cells" to work and devise our Agatha Christie Collection.
Death on the Nile features Egyptian-inspired flavors of cloves, ginger, coriander, and fennel, along with peppermint, cinnamon, and chamomile flowers, for an herbal experience that is both delicate and lethally delicious. Inspired by Christie's whodunit novel, Hallowe'en Party is a killer blend of black tea and spices will keep your taste buds on the edge of their seats. Murder on the Orient Express is a blend of black, oolong, and jasmine teas with bergamot that evokes a spirit of foreign intrigue. It’s no crime to love these teas!This set makes a killer gift for the Agatha Christie/Hercule Poirot/murder mystery fan in your life. Send it without a note, and let them guess whodunnit!
Each gift contains:
1 - Death on the Nile Tin of 20 Sachets1 - Hallowe'en Party Tin of 20 Sachets1 - Murder on the Orient Express Tin of 20 Sachets

name: Coconut Lime Oolong
description: “Put the lime in the coconut” and enjoy this sweet and fruity oolong blend that will make you feel like you are at the beach!

name: Taiwan Honey Black
description: Located in the San Shay area of New Taipei City (former rural areas that Taipei has absorbed) is a tea factory run by Mr. Li Yousheng, who has continued his father's tea business for more than 50 years! The growers enhance this unique black tea variety by utilizing natural elements. The growers intentionally allow insects to infest the tea plants. The tea plant fights back by making a bug repellent. And guess what? It tastes like honey. Let us say it does not repel us!

name: Safari Breakfast
description: Full and hearty with flavors of strong tea and spice. Blended from robust African black teas, Safari Breakfast is a striking testament to Africa’s tradition of vibrant teas and bright spices. Bold flavors and rich aromas bring a reassuring, warming quality to any morning meal.

name: Safari Breakfast, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:

name: Colonial Williamsburg Craft & Forge Yaupon Tea
description:
For centuries, Indigenous peoples in the Southeastern United States have embraced Yaupon tea, derived from the leaves of the native Yaupon plant. In 18th-century America, many people adopted Yaupon tea as an alternative to expensive imported teas from Asia, becoming a popular beverage for its affordability, accessibility, and health benefits. With antioxidants and a gentle caffeine boost, Colonial Williamsburg Craft & Forge Yaupon Tea offers a revitalizing experience in every cup.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see all Colonial Williamsburg Foundation Blends.

name: Colonial Williamsburg Craft & Forge Chai Tea
description:
Chai has a rich history that dates back more than 5,000 years to ancient India. It has been passed down through generations and is known for symbolizing warmth and hospitality. This tea has been popular for centuries due to its many health benefits, and it quickly gained a following in the West for its rich and aromatic qualities. The spices used in the brewing process, such as nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, and ginger, were highly valued commodities that were imported from distant lands in 18th-century America. These spices sparked an interest in exploring new flavors and expanded our palate for diverse global tastes.
Click here to see all Colonial Williamsburg Foundation Blends.

name: Yerba Mate Mint, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Until very recently, Yerba Mate Mint was a secret blend found only in our shops. An old employee, Hill, created it as a trial several years ago. By popular demand, we are now offering it to our online customers as well. It's a fun blend of caffeine-free mint with caffeinated Yerba Mate. Although Yerba Mate Mint is considered an herbal, it does contain caffeine. Sip this brew during long days at work or when you need to focus.*

description: Ever since Mike visited the Fenghuang mountains in southern China, he has had a weak spot for the Milan oolongs. Each year we look to find great-tasting oolongs from this area that are reminiscent of a ripe peach.

name: Chamomile Mint – Chill
description:
Enjoy relaxation at its finest anytime and anywhere with our hemp-infused Chamomile Mint tea. In the foreground, each sip contains caffeine-free chamomile with a bright dash of peppermint. Together, the flavors blend beautifully to indulge and relax the senses in one smooth, chilled-out cup. The finishing touch: 16 mg of premium hemp extract. Perfect for unwinding after a long day or simply easing tension at work. Try adding a swirl of honey for sweetness!*

name: Green Gulou
description: Our last stop during our trip to China in 2019 was up to Gulou in Hunan Province. It turns out that we were the first western tea buyers to visit this hidden valley, about four hours south of Changsha. As we rounded our way up the river valley, the air got fresher, and we got more excited. We stopped at the factory owned by Mrs. Xiao. She has run it for the last 13 years and built a beautiful garden that makes great tea. Green Gulou comes from tea plants carefully tended in the steep hills above the factory. We were impressed with the body and sweetness of this tea. These traits come from the umami found in the young tea leaves. The tea is fixed green, rolled, and dried in ovens to preserve its sweetness.

name: Harney & Sons Sand Tea Timer
description:
Brew the perfect strength of tea with the Harney & Sons Sand Tea Timer, featuring 3 different time settings to reach your perfect cup of tea. Steep your favorite green teas for 2 minutes for a light cup, 3 minutes for a bolder cup, and your everyday black or herbal tea for 5 minutes. This tea timer is made of stainless steel, which will look clean and stylish on your countertop or table!

2, 3, and 5 minute timers.
Stainless steel.
Made in China.

Dimensions (inches): 3.14h x 3.07w x 1.18d

name: Malawi Black Treasure
description: This unique tea comes from the Satemwa Tea Estates along the slopes of the Shire Highlands in South East Africa. Malawi Black Treasure is made from an endemic Malawian varietal high in antioxidants and L-theanine, the Bvumbwe cultivar. Satemwa was founded in 1923 and is currently the last family-owned and operated tea garden in Malawi. All tea from these estates is hand-picked and produced in small batches. Tasting different Satemwa teas will give you a great insight into the typical Malawian terroir.

This light-bodied oolong is delightfully smooth and creamy, with deep green rolled leaves that unfurl to reveal a soft, pale green liquor. With every sip, you’ll taste the natural sweetness of warmed milk and fresh cream—a hallmark of this beloved style of oolong, which is oh so popular across Eastern Asia. Dive into the playful indulgence of Coconut Mint, a spirited, caffeine-free concoction that brings together the zest of organic lemongrass and the warmth of ginger root. Spearmint leaves and coconut pieces add freshness and body to the cup. This blend offers a creamy, minty experience that sparks joy and imagination. Perfect for sharing with friends of all ages, our Coconut Mint tea is a sugar-free delight, ideal for enjoying at any time of day.

Celebrate vibrant flavors with Vanilla Strawberry Hibiscus. This lively yet caffeine-free blend combines the tangy zest of organic hibiscus with strawberry and vanilla's sweet and creamy notes. Organic rooibos and orange peel provide a rich, fruity base that balances the tartness of the hibiscus, creating a refreshing and invigorating cup. Ideal for a fun-filled tea party, enjoy this sugar-free blend with friends of all ages, whether they're real or imaginary, and savor a burst of joy in every sip.

description:
Our elegant Green Teabag Sampler comes filled with an assortment of 15 tea bags. Use it as an elegant teatime presentation piece or as a perfect office or host/hostess gift. name: Hallowe'en Party, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Inspired by Agatha Christie's whodunit novel Hallowe'en Party, this killer blend of black tea and spices will keep your taste buds on the edge of their seats. Prepare to be thrilled!
Please note: This blend was previously known as "A Haunting in Venice."

name: Verveine (Lemon Verbena), Bag of 50 Sachets
description: We source only the best Verveine, also known as Lemon Verbena. The big green leaves produce an unusually good body for an herbal brew with a wonderful lemon yellow color and aroma.

name: Flight of the Golden Monkeys
description:
We have been buying Golden Monkeys from Fujian Province for over 20 years. Oftentimes, the town we purchase from can vary. This year, we found four that we really enjoyed and thought we would share them all with you. Wuyisan is famous for its oolongs, so the teas are more floral. Just south of the mountains of the Baishanzu Nature Reserve sits the town of Zhenghe. The Golden Monkey made here brews dark and sweet with aromas reminiscent of molasses. Across the mountains from Zhenghe is the town of Songxi. Songxi has big leaves and brews that are lighter and sweeter. Fuan has larger, dark golden leaves. 
Please note: This product contains four individually packaged tins (Wuyisan, Zhenge, Songxi, and Fuan) containing 2 ounces each and arrives in a black and gold Harney & Sons gift box.

name: Historic Royal Palaces Teapot
description: This beautiful 33 oz. teapot is sure to stand out on any table or teatray. This English fine bone china is made in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, using traditional methods unchanged for 250 years. Each piece is skillfully finished in 22-carat gold.The Royal Palace chinaware range has been created exclusively for Historic Royal Palaces. Look closely, and you can see delicate details taken from the rose gardens at Hampton Court Palace and Hillsborough Castle, the famous gates at Kensington Palace, the Crown Jewels at the Tower of London, the Reubens ceiling at Banqueting House, and the elegant duck-egg blue from the Kew Palace Doll's House.Please note: This collection is not suitable for dishwashers or microwaves.

The result is a harmonious fusion of flavors that captivate the palate with their refined complexity. With each sip, savor the exquisite combination of sweetness and subtle saltiness, creating a truly indulgent and sophisticated tea experience.

name: Chai, Classic Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
We created Chai as our ultimate sweet and spicy chai tea after a large portion of our customers told us that our Indian Spice wasn't exactly what they were looking for in a chai tea. This blend features black tea from India, cardamom seeds, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and natural cardamom and vanilla flavors.
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Chai.

name: Chocolate Tea, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
If you love chocolate and tea and want to experience the two as one, our Chocolate Tea is an excellent choice for you. With its Chinese black base and rich aroma, it's rated quite highly by all the chocolate fanatics here at Harney & Sons. This tea is also available without caffeine, so you can enjoy it anytime, day or night. Please see Decaf Chocolate.﻿

name: Matcha Tea Frother
description:
Making your favorite rich, foamy matcha or matcha latté has never been easier with Aerolatte's Matcha Tea Frother. In less than a minute and with little effort, you'll have beautifully whisked matcha. Because it's battery operated, it won't take any extra electricity, and you can even travel with it.

Made of FDA-approved, BPA-free plastic; durable and versatile; includes frother, protective storage case, and 2 AA batteries.
Measure tea into a mug or glass, submerge the frother's whisk end, and hold the power button to froth for about 30–60 seconds until the foam has the desired consistency.
Easy to use; hand wash the whisk end in warm, soapy water.

name: Pu-erh, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
An ancient tea from Yunnan, Pu-Erh's earthy pleasures have a passionate group of followers. This particular version is a dark, savory cooked Pu-Erh and makes for a striking brew. Brigitte Harney is especially a fan. This Pu-Erh is shou style. Shou Pu-Erh is differentiated from sheng Pu-Erh in that it is fermented before it is packaged, compressed, and sold for consumption.

name: ForLife Mist Glass Iced Tea Jug, 50 oz (Assorted Colors)
description:
The Mist Iced Tea Jug was designed to create a simple way of making cold-brewed iced tea. The double-ring silicone gasket ensures the lid won't fall off while serving. The 0.5-mm-hole stainless-steel filter catches tea leaves and gives you a smooth cup of iced tea. The filter and silicone gasket are easy to take apart for cleaning. The jug is made of borosilicate, handblown glass, and can handle large temperature fluctuations. 
Parts & Materials

Jug: Lead-free borosilicate glass. Hand-wash recommended, microwavable, thermal shock resistant up to 248 °F/120°C, capacity 50 oz.

Lid: Stainless steel, polypropylene, and silicone. Extra-fine stainless steel filter attached. Silicone gasket secures the lid while in use. Dishwasher-safe, BPA-free, and heat-resistant up to 248°F/120°C.

name: Earl Grey Matcha
description: Interestingly, one of the most popular teas in our Japanese market is Earl Grey. We thought it would be a unique combination to blend the flavors of a favored tea there with a traditional green tea they are well known for. The result is a blend of East meets West that will be sure to please.

name: Brew-in-Mug Extra-fine Tea Infuser with Lid
description:
The Brew-in-Mug Extra-fine Tea Infuser with Lid is complete with an easy-grip silicone-rimmed stainless-steel lid. The infuser gives you a perfect even brew every time and enables you to brew fine teas such as Rooibos tea to large whole-leaf teas like Oolong tea. It fits in American-standard mugs. Flip the lid, and it works as an infuser holder. With this infuser, brewing your favorite cup of tea is now easier than ever!

It's the perfect New Year gift!

description:
The NewLeaf Tall Tea Mug by Forlife is designed for a simple and clean way of brewing just one fresh cup of tea.

Handcrafted from heat-resistant borosilicate glass.
Removable stainless steel infuser.
Lid functions as a drip dish for the infuser.
16 oz./473 ml.

name: Master's Mark Sencha
description: Before the main tea season gets into full gear, master tea makers prepare for the tea contests later in the year. They gather the best young tea leaves by hand so that they retain the great qualities of amino acids and the highest amount of EGCG antioxidants. They carefully process these and then store them until the contest in September. This one brewed exceptionally well, and that is why it is called Master's Mark. It is an honor to offer this special sencha.The Japanese palate is subtle. Senchas have many similar characteristics of steamed vegetal flavors, but there can be significant differences. Knowledgeable Japanese tea drinkers prefer Master's Mark Sencha due to its delicate sweetness and pronounced vegetal flavors, which are indicative of teas from Wazuka Valley, Japan.

name: Wild Spiced Ceylon
description: We found this tea on our trip to Sri Lanka. Our friend Buddika made this tea in his very small factory. He blends wild black tea with locally grown cloves and cardamom to produce a delicious tea.

name: Ceylon Vanilla Rods
description: On one of our trips to Sri Lanka, our friend Buddika made this tea at his small factory in Ratnapura. Buddika, who was born and raised in Kandy, Sri Lanka, began his career as a trainee tea planter for 17 years before deciding to transition into his own project of producing artisanal teas. Skilled tea artisans carefully pluck and process these leaves by hand. Its rich character lingers on the palate, evoking the untamed essence of Sri Lanka’s highland forests, where the tea is grown on 40-foot-tall trees! Big Ceylon leaves are tied around a vanilla bean, creating a delicious brew.

name: Artisanal Ceylon Argent
description: On one of our trips to Sri Lanka, our friend Buddika made this tea at his small factory in Ratnapura. Buddika, who was born and raised in Kandy, Sri Lanka, began his career as a trainee tea planter for 17 years before deciding to transition into his own project of producing artisanal teas. Skilled tea artisans carefully pluck and process these leaves by hand. Its rich character lingers on the palate, evoking the untamed essence of Sri Lanka’s highland forests, where the tea is grown on 40-foot-tall trees! It has a bit more complex aroma than our Ceylon Silver Tips and is very sweet.

name: Heavenly Gyokuro
description:
Heavenly Gyokuro is hand-picked just outside of Uji, Japan. Our friend Tsuyoshi uses tea from the Ujitawara and Kyotanbe mountains. This area of central Japan is known to have the best shade-grown Gyokuro. The plants gradually receive cover towards the end of the growing season. This stress forces the plant to react by adding more green-appearing chlorophyll. The combination of mouth-filling umami and a very distinctive spinach-like aroma is what makes this tea heavenly.
Uji, located 30 minutes south of Kyoto, is the primary location for growing Gyokuro. To meet the demands of the Emperor and other members of the aristocracy, there were large tea fields and many tea factories built around Kyoto. The twilight of the Edo era saw the commercialization of shade-grown teas.

name: Chamraj Nilgiri FOP
description: On his first trip to Asia in 1996, Mike visited many tea estates. Chamraj was a very distinctive one, with a rhythmic rise and fall of brilliant green tea fields punctuated by lots of lovely flowers. He has kept his eyes open for tea from Chamraj ever since. This tea is representative of teas from Nilgiri and is a sister estate to Korakundah.

name: Amba Ceylon
description: Amba Estate is located in the hills of central Sri Lanka. Simon Bell and his partners have lovingly restored this old tea estate as an experiment to rejuvenate tea making in Sri Lanka. We recently visited Amba, which we consider a little gem. Amba Ceylon comes from a group of Sri Lankan men and women who make very interesting handmade teas. Your purchase and enthusiasm for Amba teas helps support their livelihood. We're proud to offer it and think you'll enjoy its citrus flavor and subtle floral notes. Great teas made responsibly for the local population. We buy a variety of tea from them.

name: Salted Caramel, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Indulge in the luxurious experience of salted caramel black tea. This exceptional blend features a black tea base delicately infused with golden caramel flavor and a subtle hint of Himalayan salt. The result is a harmonious fusion of flavors that captivate the palate with their refined complexity. With each sip, savor the exquisite combination of sweetness and subtle saltiness, creating a truly indulgent and sophisticated tea experience.
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Salted Caramel.

name: Asanoka Sencha
description: On a recent trip to Japan to visit the Otsukas, they introduced us to this Asanoka Sencha. Kohei, our host, shared with us the current production of this lighter steamed Sencha, and immediately we were hooked. An early season Sencha coming from eastern Kyushu, the sweet tropical fruit aromas dance delicately above a mellow-bodied cup. The brew is well-balanced umami, with a faint trace of astringency to give it confidence.

name: Wazuka Guricha
description:
This tea comes from the Wazuka Valley in Kyoto Prefecture, Japan, and is made by Mr. Wataru. He is a promising young farmer in Wazuka, located on the opposite ridge from where Matsuda, another of our favorite Japanese tea growers, produces tea. Wataru-san is a college graduate that applies novel approaches to making tea, blending Japanese tradition with modern methods. This Guricha is made from the short-period shaded Saemidori cultivar, which has a strong umami. To preserve this feature, he’s opted to omit the last step in traditional sencha making, rolling, which can increase the body of the tea but reduce its umami. The recommendation from Mr. Wataru is to enjoy two steepings. The first is refreshing with vegetal notes, whereas the second will become much more bold.
Guricha (steamed curly tea) is a kind of Japanese green tea found mainly in Kyushu, the southern island of Japan. Guricha follows a lot of the same processing that Sencha does, except for the last rolling, which is how most Senchas acquire their needle-like shape. This last rolling’s purpose is to damage the structure of the tea leaf, so without this process, Guricha has a lighter taste to it than standard Senchas.

name: Teesta Valley 1st Flush
description: We visited Teesta Valley on the eastern edge of the Darjeeling tea area years ago. However, the memories of the lovely estate are fresh. Waking before dawn to hike to the top of the estate for pictures was such a pleasure, and descending to drink copious amounts of tea made that day memorable. Drinking this solid first flush brings back those fond memories.

name: Greek Mountain Herb
description: Handcrafted from the finest leaves harvested in the mountains of Greece, this tea transports you to a land rich in natural wonders. Delight in the harmonious fusion of earthy sage and zesty citrus notes, creating a truly exceptional and revitalizing cup. Embrace the essence of Greece in every sip and let the soothing flavors of our Greek Mountain Herb Tea whisk you away to a world of pure bliss.

name: Indigo Punch, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Vibrant and full of crisp, fruity flavors, our caffeine-free Indigo Punch combines the delicate tang of rose hips and apple pieces. The earthy tones of the gorgeous Butterfly Pea Flower make this a unique blend. Bright lemongrass, lemon peel, and vivid raspberry round out this beautiful brew, along with natural honey flavor for a touch of sweetness. 

Please note: The mineral content of your water source will affect the color of the brew. Our photos use local spring water sourced from the Berkshires. If the color of your brew is different, please consider trying an alternative water source. 
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Indigo Punch.

This tea was imagined and created by our French intern, Marine. Her idea was simple: to transport you to her native region of Provence. The inspiration for this tea is the fields of lavender, apricots, and lemons found in the French towns that border the Mediterranean. Our Provence tea is a soft melange of floral and fruit flavors.

name: Tausug Blend, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
This special Tausug Tea Blend was exclusively created by Harney & Sons with the Royal Warrant of His Royal Majesty Sultan Muedzul-Lail Tan Kiram, the 35th Sultan of Sulu and North Borneo. The Royal Sultanate of Sulu was officially founded as a theocratic state in 1457 in the Southern Philippines. The Tausug people of Sulu have been a sovereign people for more than 600 years.
In celebration and support for the vibrant Tausug people and the Royal Sultanate of Sulu, a portion of the proceeds from each purchase of this tea supports Sultan Kiram's many charitable humanitarian programs that include protecting seniors at risk of homelessness, providing educational support for less fortunate students, and providing relief and medical aid for impoverished families. The Royal Sultanate of Sulu is committed to promulgating peace, education, climate change awareness, and economic development in the Sulu Archipelago.

name: Dong Ding Light
description: Dong Ding is one of the original oolongs, produced in the mountains in the middle of Taiwan. There are two schools of production. This variety is one we have sourced over the years, and it is a lightly roasted oolong with pleasant lemon and vegetal flavors. Tea makers have cultivated Dong Ding around the town of Luku in the foothills of Taiwan's central mountain range since the mid-1800s. They adopted the production methods of their cousins in southern Fujian Province, China and roll the large tea leaves into a ball. We visited Mr. Shen in 2024 and enjoyed it very much, so we decided to bring it back again!

name: Celebration Tea, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:

A final layer of sweet vanilla flavor and spiced cloves finishes the brew for an easy-to-drink cup that sparkles with richness.
 Each tin contains 30 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!

name: Pure Wild Honeybush
description: This wild bush is harvested northeast of Cape Town, South Africa. Since it is wild, harvesting it by hand is necessary. Similar to tea, the bush sustains damage and undergoes color changes. Its flavors are like dark honey.

name: African Antlers
description: Traditionally, African teas are bold and powerful. When this tea from Malawi came across our path from the Satemwa estate, we were so enthralled by its beautiful leaves and its delicious flavor. We are excited to share this tea with you.

name: Japanese Whisky, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Japanese whisky has grown in popularity, so we were excited when this tea was offered to us. As whisky fans, we couldn't resist it! Japanese Whisky is a rare tea that comes to us from Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan. It's made using the same cultivar as most Senchas, Yabukita. During its extensive processing, it is finished with an 8-hour smoking over wood chips made from Japanese whisky barrels.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Japanese Whisky.

name: Wedding Tea, Personalized Tin of 30 Sachets
description:
We created Wedding Tea as an elegant blend for your momentous event. It features Mutan White tea with lemon-vanilla to taste, with a touch of pink rosebuds and petals. Caffeinated.
Each tin contains 30 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!
Please note: Allow two weeks processing and shipping time for all Wedding Tea Personalized Tins. We may get them to you sooner, yet we regret we cannot guarantee faster turnaround.
