name: Rwandan Rukeri
description:
Emeric Harney had the pleasure of traveling to Rukeri Estate years ago, beginning our relationship with this estate. A beautiful estate with bright green, rolling hills that's just beside a very well-known lake in Africa, Lake Kivu.
In memoriam to a great tea man, Joe Wertheim, we offer this tea from his estate in Rwanda. Joe established it many years ago, and it has become a desired source of tea in many blends. This particular tea is made in the orthodox way (rather than the stronger CTC way that produces familiar leaves that look like pellets), so it is a more mellow and sophisticated offering of Rukeri. Please try one of Africa’s finest teas.

name: Angiogenesis Foundation Green Tea
description:
The Angiogenesis Foundation is a non-profit organization helping people lead healthier, longer lives through angiogenesis-based treatment and prevention.



The Angiogenesis Foundation Green Tea has a delicate, soft flavor with a subtle floral essence, perfect for everyday enjoyment. This tea is hand-picked and hand-rolled from select Chinese and Japanese green tea leaves that are shown to be anti-angiogenic (cancer-starving). According to the Angiogenesis Foundation, drinking green tea has numerous health benefits.
For more information about how green tea can protect your health, visit the Angiogenesis Foundation’s Eat to Beat information hub.

name: Anniversary Blend
description: Anniversary Blend is an updated version of a classic tea blend that John Harney first offered back in 1983. It features silvery Ceylon and golden Assam, accented by Ceylon Silver Tips and Assam Golden Tips. Besides making the blend extra special, these teas offer added sweetness and elegance.

name: Ginger Liquorice, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Sometimes simplicity is best. Our Ginger Liquorice is a no-fuss infusion that exudes the pure quality of its ingredients and enjoyably drinkable flavors. Spicy, fair-bodied ginger and sweet notes of soothing liquorice play against one another for a simple yet elegant palate. Caffeine-free and full of delightful flavors, this brew makes a wonderful cleanser after a long day or a post-lunch soother.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Ginger Liquorice.

name: Tilleul, Box of 20 Individually Wrapped Sachets
description:
From Provence, France comes Tilleul, a light and lively blend of the linden tree's fragrant flowers and leaves. The naturally caffeine-free herbal is prized for its subtle floral quality as well as its mild digestive and sleep benefits. The flowers and tender leaves produce a light, woodsy brew as beautiful as its taste in a mingling of forest-like green and yellow that's all part of the charm.
Each box contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each sachet is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!
Ingredients: Tilleul (linden leaves).
Click here to see additional purchasing options of Tilleul.

name: Tilleul (Linden Leaves)
description:
From Provence, France, comes Tilleul, a light and lively blend of the linden tree's fragrant flowers and leaves. The naturally caffeine-free herbal is prized for its subtle floral quality as well as its mild digestive and sleep benefits. The flowers and tender leaves produce a light, woodsy brew as beautiful as its taste in a mingling of forest-like green and yellow; that's all part of the charm.
Please note: We will be packing this in a cut leaf due to availability issues.

name: Jobetsugi Ceremonial Matcha (Thin Grade)
description:
This is an excellent matcha from the beautiful Watzuka Valley, south of Uji, Japan, and other nearby prefectures. The first crop (harvested in May) is used to make this matcha. This is the time when the amino acids that create the mouth-filling umami are at their best. The tea plants are shaded and air-dried into Tencha. Later, they are ground by the tiny stone mills. To make a small tin takes about two hours. Hot, iced, or blended with some sort of milk, this is a matcha to enjoy!
Make sure to check out all our Matcha teas!

name: American Buzz
description:
Wake up and smell the Yaupon. Our American Buzz is made from a timeless blend of the three caffeinated hollies for an All-American brew that's sure to put a little spring in your step. We began with Yaupon from a Texas ranch, blending it with rustic, earthy Guayusa holly from Ecuador, Brazilian shade-grown Yerba Mate, and a bright twist of Spearmint from Washington for tang. This is one brew you'll want to drink sitting down.
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.

name: Matcha Iri Genmaicha, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Matcha is a much beloved green tea in Japan, yet it can seem intense to the uninitiated westerner. As an alternative, we suggest Matcha iri Genmaicha, the best of both worlds. The Bancha ("cha") leaves and brown rice ("genmai") that comprise Genmaicha are coated with Matcha green tea powder, and the result is fantastic!
Please brew it for 3 minutes with 175º water. The cooler water makes sure matcha does not get too strong, yet you need 3 minutes to get the nutty flavor from the genmai (brown rice). 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

description:

An extra-fine 0.3-mm hole infuser makes it easy to steep your finest loose leaf teas without any fuss or unnecessarily complicated clean-up, whether you prefer fine teas like Rooibos or large-leaf favorites like Da Hong Pao. Each teapot brews a hearty 24 oz. of tea and is dishwasher- and microwave-safe. Stainless steel infuser is safe for dishwasher only.

Capacity: 24 oz.
Ceramic teapot is dishwasher- and microwave-safe.
Stainless steel infuser is dishwasher-safe only.
Not meant for use on electric or gas ranges.

name: Matcha Sets (Assorted Styles)
description:
Perfect for matcha gurus and beginning enthusiasts alike, our Matcha Set includes all the essentials for a delicious cup of frothy Matcha. Use the bamboo matcha scoop (chashaku) to measure out your matcha and place it into the 12 oz. handmade ceramic matcha bowl. Add an appropriate amount of water (hot but not quite boiling), and whisk with the bamboo matcha whisk (chasen) until your matcha is uniform in consistency, free of clumps, and frothy to taste. The bowl is made in Japan.
The set includes:
1 - Handmade Ceramic Matcha Bowl, 12 oz.
1 - Bamboo Matcha Whisk (chasen)
1 - Bamboo Matcha Scoop (chashaku)


Please note: Matcha bowls are handmade. No two are exactly alike, and variations occur. The bowl may not be exactly as pictured.

It is considered a thick matcha, meaning it has sufficient umami that provides sweetness and mouth-filling flavors, allowing one to add more to create a texture similar to thick mud. That is appreciated in traditional Japanese tea ceremonies.

The kettle holds your settings when removed from the base, and there's a blue backlit water window that gives a clear view when you refill it. It automatically switches into energy-saving power mode if not used for 5 minutes. Equipped with auto shutoff and boil-dry protection. The water filter keeps water tasting pure and can be removed for easy cleaning. The brushed stainless steel finish complements any kitchen countertop.

Capacity: 57 oz./1.7 L

With every sip, you’ll taste the natural sweetness of warmed milk and fresh cream—a hallmark of this beloved style of oolong, which is oh so popular across Eastern Asia. Comforting and easy to drink, Milky Oolong offers a silky, mellow experience from the first sip to the last.

description: For many years, our Indian Spice was our only black tea version of what many people know as "chai." Assam tea, freshly ground cardamom, and spices combined together create this hauntingly subtle spice tea blend. Add some milk and sugar, and you could be in Calcutta awaiting the fresh teas coming down from Assam and Darjeeling. Please give it a try!

name: Elaine's Blend
description:
Elaine's Blend is a uniquely refreshing combination of fine Darjeeling, Keemun, Ceylon, and Assam teas. It was created by Elaine Cogan, a colleague of John Harney for many years. Little did Elaine realize she was launching the tea revolution when her complaints about the poor quality of restaurant tea were printed in the New York Times back in 1983. In response, the Times printed an editorial entitled "Tea Snobs and Coffee Bigots." John Harney and Elaine soon became friends and spread the word about tea. They were pleasantly surprised and gratified to witness tea's newfound popularity and the American public's ensuing demand for fine tea. After reading all the positive reviews, Elaine wanted us to share this with you:

Dear Tea Lovers:
It is with delight that I read you are enjoying my Special Blend. I brewed and tasted many different combinations of fine black teas before I chose the right mix of Keemun, Darjeeling, Ceylon, and Assam. It is with great pleasure that the very fine tea purveyors, Harney & Sons, make it available to discerning tea drinkers. I lift my cup to all of you. Enjoy!
Elaine

name: Supreme Breakfast

name: Brigitte's Blend
description: Brigitte's Blend is named for the mother of three of the Harney grandchildren and the wife of Mike Harney. It's an elegant mixture of silvery Ceylon and tippy, full-leaf Assam. Like Brigitte, this signature Harney & Sons blend is perfect in many situations.

You'll find it remains a contemporaneously harmonious blend, with notes from each tea working in agreement.
We're proud to have learned that our family friend and owner of the Fort Restaurant has been inducted into the Colorado Restaurant Hall of Fame with a Lifetime Achievement Award.

name: Malachi McCormick
description: We created Malachi McCormick, a black tea blend of Assam and Keemun, to honor its namesake, an Irish author and small-press publisher. Though his handmade book A Decent Cup of Tea is diminutive, Malachi McCormick's words speak volumes concerning the difficulty of finding well-prepared tea in hotels. "Malachi," as this tea has come to be known among its many fans, has long since become a favorite morning or afternoon cup. The 8 oz. and the 4 oz. loose tea tins still feature their original hand-drawn label design.

name: East Frisian
description: Fortify yourself with East Frisian, our popular full-bodied black tea blend of Darjeeling, Ceylon, and Assam. It's named after East Frisia, Germany's cold, wet, and dreary North Sea coast—the ideal spot to drink hot tea, and the East Frisians do! They consume more black tea than anyone else in the world. They do drink it with cream and crystallized sugar.

name: All India Blend
description: India consistently bears the gift of great tea. All India Blend features teas from the three best regions: Assam, Darjeeling, and Nilgiri. Each tea brings its own special strengths: body, briskness, and aroma, yielding a delightful melange.

name: Decaf Mango
description:
Superb for finding a moment of peace amidst frenzied afternoons, our Decaf Mango tea packs the explosively bright flavors of caffeine-free mango in a delicious tropical brew. Savor the sweet, fruity aromas as it steeps, and then enjoy the mellow sweetness of mango as the subtle textures whisk you away for a second of quiet in the evening. Perfect for enjoying hot or cold, sweet or unsweet, whatever the season. (See also Mango for our caffeinated black tea version.)
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Organic Breakfast Tea
description: There are increasingly more options for organic teas from India. Our Organic Breakfast is a traditional blend of a light, malty Assam from the northern bank of the Brahmaputra River, mellowed by subtle citrus notes of Korakundah from southern India. It's a very nice combination for your morning tea, great by itself or served with milk.

name: Golden Blend
description: We're pleased to offer Golden Blend, a recent blend of Golden Monkey from Fujian Province with Assam FTGFOP. This combination makes a substantially great tea that tastes delicious with milk and sugar.

name: Decaf Vanilla Comoro
description:
We're pleased to offer Vanilla Comoro, our popular decaffeinated version of Vanilla Black tea! Now you may enjoy our favorite vanilla dessert tea to your heart's content and still get a good night's sleep.
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Decaf Peaches & Ginger
description:
We made our popular Peaches & Ginger black tea blend in decaffeinated form! This tea combines the flavors of juicy peaches with ginger's zing. It contains pieces of real peaches and ginger. 
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Palm Court
description: Center court for New York's tea world is the newly re-launched Palm Court at The Plaza Hotel. Palm Court, our classic blend of four teas (Keemun, Assam, Ceylon, and Formosa Oolong), is the beverage of choice in that impressively grand setting. Prepare and enjoy a cup at home, and imagine yourself relaxing in that splendid palace on Fifth Avenue.

name: Colombian Black
description: Who would equate Colombia and tea? Most would not. However, we do have the advantage of having Elvira Cardenas as a tea taster, and she is a very good one. So, when she said someone in her country made good tea, we gave it a try. The company, named Himalaya, is located in the mountains of Colombia in the town of La Cumbre and honors traditional tea practices. We chose black and green tea. They are both quite tasty and worth a try.

name: Scottish Afternoon
description: Scottish Afternoon is slightly more aromatic and lighter than Scottish Morn, yet it is still a strong tea. A portion of the sales goes to support the charitable endeavors of the American-Scottish Foundation®.

name: Yin Hao Jasmine
description: Our exceptional scented Yin Hao Jasmine begins with a very flavorful Pouchong (an almost green tea)—then, for seven nights fresh jasmine flowers are interspersed among the tea leaves. The dry leaves absorb the floral essence, preserving it for your brewing pleasure.

name: SGS Special English Breakfast
description: We created Special English Breakfast, a strong blend of black teas from India, Sri Lanka, and Kenya, in association with the St. George’s Society of New York. Founded in 1770, the Society provides vital support to people in need across New York’s five boroughs and serves as one of America’s oldest charities. A portion of the proceeds from each purchase of this tea supports their charitable endeavors, including protecting seniors at risk of homelessness, enabling low-income students to complete their college education, and helping families affected by pediatric cancer. For more information on the Society’s work, please visit www.stgeorgessociety.org

name: Orange Pekoe (Ceylon & India)
description: Orange Pekoe is a classic, satisfying blend of strong Assam and smooth-liquor Ceylon. A traditional staple in many households, John Harney always drank this tea whenever he needed a mellow, comforting cup. This is made from small, broken (BOP) teas in the British tradition. Also known as Ceylon & India.

name: Irish Breakfast
description: Our Irish Breakfast tea is 100% Assam, and like most traditional Irish blends, this is a great way to begin your morning. In contrast to other versions of Irish Breakfast tea, you could say ours is a little more sophisticated. It tastes great on its own or takes milk and sugar well.

name: Kenya Milima
description: The tea plants that produce this tea grow at more than 6,000 feet above sea level in the Kenyan Highlands. The leaves take on lovely flavors in the cool air and rocky soil. Unlike most teas in Africa, Milima is produced using the Orthodox method, so the leaves look like most of our other teas. Its brew is light-bodied and tends toward citrus. Milima has led the revolution in Africa by making tea in the Orthodox method. This tea led the way to Africa's emergence as a quality supplier. We now offer a few African teas, unlike some years ago.

name: Stanley's Blend
description: "Before learning from Stanley Mason, tea was just a nice drink. He showed me how to make great teas and also taught me the traditions of tea. What he gave to me, I passed on down to my sons. Please enjoy this simple blend of Assam and Darjeeling." - John Harney

name: Jasmine Tea
description: Flavoring teas with jasmine flowers is an ancient Chinese tradition. The base of our Jasmine is a pouchong tea, which is slightly browner than green tea. We add fresh jasmine flowers to create a delicate and fragrant brew.

name: Decaf Sencha
description:
Are you looking for a plain green tea that has flavor and some body without caffeine? We propose our Decaf Sencha as your clear choice. People who choose to drink decaf teas often get a bad deal. We wanted to offer them something better. We work with tea suppliers and decaffeination factories to make good-tasting green teas. We supplied the good teas, and they removed the caffeine using carbon dioxide. Harney & Sons offers simply the best!
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas.

name: Queen Catherine
description: We created Queen Catherine, a Harney & Sons signature blend of three Chinese black teas (Keemun, Panyang, and Yunnan), in honor of Queen Catherine of Braganza, who introduced her love of tea to the British. We are privileged to have this tea featured in the Museum of Tea in Hangzhou, China. Harney & Sons is the only western tea company to have received this honor.

name: Midsummer's Peach (Decaf)
description:
The best of peachy summer delights in a single blend. A tantalizingly delicious concoction of decaffeinated black tea and the juicy flavors of fresh peaches, Midsummer's Peach is fragrant, enjoyably nimble, and comforting. Equally suited as a light morning beverage or a relaxing cup in the evening. Enjoy hot for a warming cup full of summery peach aromas when it's chilly, or pour over ice for a refreshing fruity chill on a steamy afternoon.
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Decaf Ceylon (Decaf Orange Pekoe)
description:
Our Decaf Ceylon, also known as Decaf Orange Pekoe, is a high-quality black tea with the caffeine removed, yet the depth of flavor remains intact. Customers tell us our Ceylon is the only decaf that tastes like "real tea."
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Paris Herbal
description: Over the years, Paris has become one of our most popular teas. Many people love the complex blend of fruit, citrus, and creamy vanilla, though some of you requested an herbal alternative without caffeine. We're pleased to offer a new Paris Herbal as a tisane, using a Rooibos base. We believe you will love this version, too.

name: Royal English Breakfast
description:
A stout combination of Kenilworth Ceylon and Kenya Milima black teas makes a smooth, medium-bodied brew. Royal English Breakfast is delicious when complemented with milk and sugar.

Historic Royal Palaces is an independent charity that looks after the Tower of London, Hampton Court Palace, the Banqueting House, Kensington Palace, Kew Palace and Hillsborough Castle and Gardens.

name: Decaf Darjeeling
description:
If you love Darjeeling yet want to reduce your caffeine consumption, we suggest trying our Decaf Darjeeling tea. Our customers rate it quite highly as a delicious alternative to the traditional Queen of Teas.
Click here to see all of our decaffeinated teas!

name: HarSha
description: HarSha is a black tea blend Mike developed as a fulfilling breakfast tea. It is a blend of extraordinary broken tippy Assam to give body and depth and muscatel 2nd flush Darjeeling to add a little dark fruity flavor. HarSha is a Hindi word from India, meaning "bliss." Mike thinks you will agree.

name: Pumpkin Spice
description: A delectable harvest-time brew, our Pumpkin Spice tea is the perfect way to relax at the end of the day. This herbal tea features a masterful autumnal blend of pumpkin flavors and spices that will warm you up, inside and out. A vibrant red in color, you'll find this brew sports a light body and wonderful flavors. Offered seasonally in limited quantities. Caffeine-free.

name: Organic Korakundah
description: Korakundah has been seeing a lot of us Harneys. Alex has been there four times, and Mike twice. This Organic Korakundah FOP is nice and mellow—a good everyday tea. It is sourced from the highest area in the Nilgiri tea region in southern India.

name: Russian Country
description: A blend of four great teas (Keemun, Assam, Ceylon, and Formosa Oolong) with a touch of Lapsang Souchong, Russian Country is a softer version of the characteristically smoky Lapsang Souchong. This blend is also reminiscent of teas that were once carried east by camel across the rugged Asian deserts to Russia. As Norwood Pratt quips, "The only choice was one hump or two."

name: Scottish Morn
description: Scottish Morn is a strong tea, perhaps our very strongest. When you stand your spoon up in this tea, it might just stand straight. A portion of Scottish Morn and Scottish Afternoon sales goes to support the charitable endeavors of the American-Scottish Foundation®.

name: Dragon Pearl Jasmine
description: A masterpiece from Fuan, China, Dragon Pearl Jasmine is comprised of little, hand-rolled 'pearls' gently infused with jasmine flowers. The blend is pure joy, with the floral and sweet aromas of the light-colored brew.

name: Decaf Paris
description:
Nighttime tea lovers may enjoy Decaf Paris, our alternative version of Paris, one of Harney & Sons' most popular and talked-about blends. Relax with the same great fruity flavors of vanilla, caramel, and bergamot with a decaf black tea base and still get a good night's sleep!
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Birthday Party
description: We created Decaf Birthday Tea to honor Master Tea Blender John Harney on his 80th birthday. Delightfully fruity and aromatic, Birthday Tea combines luscious fruit and berry flavors with flowers and brews a beautiful crimson-colored cup of tea. Worthy of your special day, too, enjoy it served hot or iced.

name: Decaf Assam
description:
Try our Decaf Assam tea if you love the malty flavors of traditional Assam but want to reduce your caffeine consumption. It handles milk and sugar and may also be enjoyed solo.
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Decaf Earl Grey
description:
Our Decaf Earl Grey starts with our Decaf Ceylon, to which we add natural oil of bergamot, found in traditional Earl Grey blends. (See also Earl Grey for our caffeinated black tea version.)

Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Harney & Sons Logo Timer
description: Brew your teas just right with our Harney & Sons Logo Timer! This timer is a great kitchen companion as it is steamproof, waterproof, and shatterproof. It has both an audio and visual cue for when it's reached the end of the time set. It comes with a magnetic back, which makes for easy mounting on your fridge, and it has a kick stand to stay upright on your counter. Two AAA batteries are included.

name: Harney & Sons Tote Bag
description:
The perfect way to show off your Harney pride! Sporting a design that lists some of our most popular and favorite teas, this tote is made from 100% natural cotton. Made in Brooklyn, NY.

Dimensions (inches): 14h x 14.5w x 3d

name: Yaupon Black
description:
The Yaupon revival is an inspiring American comeback. Southern ranchers declared this native holly invasive and cleared acres of scrub. They forgot (or perhaps some never knew) that the drought-tolerant bushes yield a robust, naturally caffeinated tea.
Harney & Sons sources sustainably harvested, toasty Yaupon Black leaf tea in Texas from ranches that promote social justice. Steep as you would other handcrafted black teas, and enjoy the uniquely American buzz.
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.

name: Winter White Earl Grey, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Earl Grey is a very popular tea here at Harney & Sons, so we offer many variations. They all have one thing in common: the wonderful lemony aromas and flavors that come from our oil of bergamot. It is the base that makes them different. Winter White uses Mutan White, making it lighter than traditional black teas. It has as its base the vegetal and, oh, so lightly fruity flavors of Mutan White Tea. If you want something lighter than traditional Earl Grey, this is a great choice.
Each HT tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Winter White Earl Grey.

name: Chinese Flower
description: Our Chinese Flower tea is a joy for the eyes and the palate. A beautiful and aromatic blend of Chun Mee and three types of flower petals, you'll notice accents of citrus flavors.

name: Colombian Green
description: Who would equate Colombia and tea? Most would not. However, we do have the advantage of having Elvira Cardenas as a tea taster, and she is a very good one. So, when she said someone in her country made good tea, we gave it a try. The company, named Himalaya, is located in the mountains of Colombia in the town of La Cumbre and honors traditional tea practices. We chose black and green tea. They are both quite tasty and worth a try.

name: Yerba Mate Mint
description:
Until very recently, Yerba Mate Mint was a secret blend found only in our shops. An old employee, Hill, created it as a trial several years ago. By popular demand, we are now offering it to our online customers as well. It's a fun blend of caffeine-free mint with caffeinated Yerba Mate. Although Yerba Mate Mint is considered an herbal, it does contain caffeine. Sip this brew during long days at work or when you need to focus.*
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.


*These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA (Food and Drug Administration). This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

name: Goji Berry Fruit Tea
description:
About 30 years ago, friend and colleague Andrew Demmer decided to mix dried fruit and flavors together for his tea shops in Vienna, Austria. These blends were not from the tea plant, were caffeine-free, and were refreshingly delicious. Andrew decided to call them fruit teas. They have become popular in Middle Europe and now here in the States. Our selection of fruit tea blends brews up a wonderful red color and has vibrant flavors. Caffeine-free.
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: Decaf Chocolate Tea
description:
This decaffeinated version of our Chocolate Tea has the soothing and satisfying flavors of natural chocolate without the caffeine. Decaf Chocolate is a pleasant alternative when you crave the same rich aroma and taste but need a decaf base instead of full-strength black tea. Enjoy it anytime.
Click here to see all our decaffeinated teas!

name: Allnighter Yerba Mate Licorice
description:
In college, workdays, and beyond, there are times we have to burn the midnight oil, pull an allnighter, and find ourselves needing more caffeine than black tea yields. To keep everyone going stronger (and a bit longer), Mike created Yerba Mate Licorice, a blend of two highly caffeinated herbals, Yerba Mate and Guayusa, with a bit of licorice to make it taste great. Sure to stimulate you as you work the night away!
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.

name: Peaches & Ginger, HT Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Enjoy Peaches & Ginger, a popular addition to our selection of flavored black teas. This blend combines the irresistible flavors of fresh peaches with the 'zing' of ginger. Enjoy it hot or iced. 
Each HT tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or reuse it and refill it with one of our Bags of 50!﻿
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Peaches & Ginger.

name: Celebration Tea
description: Based on traditional English flavors, this irresistible blend of black tea is perfect for gatherings of friends and families. Our Celebration Tea captures the magic of the seasons, especially Hanukkah. "Savor this limited edition tea anytime of the day or gift it to someone you love." – John Harney

name: Amba Lemongrass
description: Delectably refreshing and caffeine-free, with sparkling aromas of citrus, this lovely lemongrass offering comes from the artisans at Amba Estate. Savor Amba Lemongrass's approachable lemon flavors, letting the overarching, breezy freshness dance over your palate like a spring day. This infusion's medium body makes it delightful to drink on its own, but it's equally delicious paired with your favorite biscuit."Amba" is an experiment in trying to treat tea employees better. It is located in the mountains, near Sri Lanka. This is their delicious lemongrass. Elvira and Mike visited Amba in the spring of 2023.

name: Blueberry Green
description: For Blueberry Green, we've artfully blended Chinese green tea with lemongrass, blueberry, and vanilla to create a brew that's sure to hit all the right notes. Delicious hot or iced.

name: Capri
description: Reminiscent of Isola di Capri in Italy, Capri combines dried figs, tart lemon, and a hint of vanilla. A wonderful naturally flavored black tea, just as miraculous as the coastal scenes from the island!

name: Chai, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
We created Chai as our ultimate sweet and spicy chai tea after a large portion of our customers told us that our Indian Spice wasn't exactly what they were looking for in a chai tea. This blend features black tea from India, cardamom seeds, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and natural cardamom and vanilla flavors.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Chai.

name: Chai, Box of 20 Premium Teabags
description:
We created Chai as our ultimate sweet and spicy chai tea after a large portion of our customers told us that our Indian Spice wasn't exactly what they were looking for in a chai tea. This blend features black tea from India, cardamom seeds, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and natural cardamom and vanilla flavors. 
Each box contains 20 teabags.Each teabag brews one 6-8 oz. cup of tea.Each teabag is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!
﻿Click here to see additional purchasing options for Chai.

name: Chai
description:
We created Chai as our ultimate sweet and spicy chai tea after a large portion of our customers told us that our Indian Spice wasn't exactly what they were looking for in a chai tea. This blend features black tea from India, cardamom seeds, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and natural cardamom and vanilla flavors.
Click here to see our Decaffeinated Chai.

name: Cranberry Autumn
description: Sweet and tart, our Cranberry Autumn is a black tea artfully blended with cranberry and orange flavors. You'll find it a full-bodied brew that is exceptionally smooth and delicious in the fall, or anytime if you're a cranberry fan.

name: Scottish Afternoon, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Scottish Afternoon is slightly more aromatic and lighter than Scottish Morn, yet it is still a strong tea. A portion of the sales goes to support the charitable endeavors of the American-Scottish Foundation®.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Scottish Afternoon.

name: Scottish Morn, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Scottish Morn is a strong tea, perhaps our very strongest. When you stand your spoon up in this tea, it might just stand straight. A portion of Scottish Morn and Scottish Afternoon sales goes to support the charitable endeavors of the American-Scottish Foundation®.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Scottish Morn.

name: La Rochère Napoleon Bee Mug
description:
La Rochère has been making traditional French glassware since 1475. Now a classic, the Napoleon Bee mug is nicely weighted with a comfortable handle. It's made inside an open mold in two parts and pressed together when the glass is in molten form. This process creates the clearest and most durable type of glass, known for its characteristic seam.

Dishwasher-safe.
Capacity 8 oz.

name: Pumpkin Spice, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
A delectable harvest-time brew, our Pumpkin Spice tea is the perfect way to relax at the end of the day. This herbal tea features a masterful autumnal blend of pumpkin flavors and spices that will warm you up, inside and out. A vibrant red in color, you'll find this brew sports a light body and wonderful flavors. Offered seasonally in limited quantities. Caffeine-free.
 

Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!



Click here to see additional purchasing options for Pumpkin Spice.

name: Organic Green with Coconut Fresh Brew Iced Tea
description:
Long a favorite in its incarnation as a hot tea, our Organic Green with Coconut is equally enjoyable and delicious over ice. A wonderful breeze of refreshment on a warm, sunny day, our fragrant blend of organic green tea, lemongrass, ginger, vanilla, and sweet coconut comes packaged in handy pouches suitable for brewing 2 quarts of iced tea each. Enjoy your favorite blend in a refreshing new way, sweetened or unsweetened. Formerly known as Bangkok Iced Tea.

Click here to see additional purchasing options for Organic Green with Coconut.


Be sure to check out all our Fresh Brew Iced Teas.

name: A Perfect Cup Tea Scoop – Stainless Steel
description: A utensil that's delighted to do double duty, our Perfect Tea Spoon measures just enough tea for a superb cup every time. But if you happen to be baking while you enjoy your tea, the Perfect Tea Spoon doubles as a 1 tsp. measuring spoon for spices or other ingredients. Made from dishwasher-safe and durable 18/10 stainless steel.

name: Harney & Sons Black Empty Tea Tin - 8 oz
description:
Need more storage for your budding tea collection? Harney & Sons also offers our signature black tins for your own personal use. Use them to store your tea and other goodies.
Please note: The tea spoon and tea are not included. If you're interested in also purchasing our Stainless Tea Scoop to make the perfect cup, click  here.

Dimensions (inches): 4.625h x 3.5w x 3.5d

name: Harney & Sons Black Empty Tea Tin - 4 oz
description:
Need more storage for your budding tea collection? Harney & Sons also offers our signature black tins for your own personal use. Use them to store your tea and other goodies.
Please note: Tea spoon and tea are not included. If you're interested in also purchasing our Stainless Tea Scoop to make the perfect cup, click here.

Dimensions (inches): 3.75h x 2.625w x 2.625d

name: Harney & Sons Black Empty Tea Tin – 3 lb
description:
Need more storage for your budding tea collection? Harney & Sons also offers our signature black tins for your own personal use. Use them to store your tea and other goodies.
Please note: Tea spoon and tea are not included. If you're interested in also purchasing our Stainless Tea Scoop to make the perfect cup, click here.

Dimensions (inches): 8.5h x 5.75w x 4.75d

name: Tea Strainer – Silver Plated, Short Handle
description:
An elegant, no-fuss solution for enjoying your favorite loose leaf blend with ease. This silver-plated strainer fits over the rim of your teacup, allowing you to strain your tea leaves as you pour. Its gleaming plating and charming design will add a dash of sophistication to any tea tray.

Short handle with nest.
Base metal: Brass.
Lead-free.

This product is not eligible for discounts.

name: Blood Orange Fruit Tea
description:
Our Blood Orange Fruit Tea, a brilliant blend of dried fruit, has the lovely and distinctive twist found in blood oranges. Delicious hot or cold, it brews an aromatic and vivid shade of orange. Caffeine-free.
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: Diamond Jubilee
description: In 2012, Elizabeth II celebrated her Diamond Jubilee. To celebrate her 60 years of rule, we created this blend specially to honor the Queen and her achievements. Inspired by Earl Grey, our Diamond Jubilee blend combines black teas with the lemony flavors of bergamot and citrus-filled grapefruit essences for a light yet complex twist on the Queen's favorite tea. Brisk, refreshing, and fragrant, Diamond Jubilee happily stands on its own or can be taken with a splash of milk.

name: Tea Strainer – Silver Plated, Long Handle
description:
Elegant yet functional, our silver-plated loose tea strainer fits over your teacup's rim, catching any loose leaves that flow from the spout of your teapot. The strainer's silver plating gives it a glint, while the heavy construction makes it entirely practical. Perfect for easing clean-up after enjoying your favorite brew or adding a touch of sophistication and traditional charm to any tea presentation.

Long handle with nest.
Base metal: Brass.
Lead-free. 


This product is not eligible for discounts.

name: Oval with Punchwork Design Tea Scoop – Stainless Steel
description: This 18/10 stainless steel tea scoop features an intricate punchwork design and a gently curved handle. It's ideal for scooping loose tea and may be used as a caddy for spent tea bags. Add a flourish to formal dinners or the buffet table by using it to serve jams, jellies, condiments, or sugar. Dishwasher-safe.

name: Jasmine Fairy Maidens
description: An exquisite flowering tea, Jasmine Fairy Maidens comes with a hidden surprise. Remove it from the package, and you'd be forgiven for thinking you were brewing a plain bundle of lightly aromatic green tea. Add less than boiling water, however, and watch as the bloom unfurls into a blossom with a center of fragrant jasmine flowers and delicate silver-green leaves at the base. Enjoy the gentle flavors and sweet aromas on a special occasion or as a treat after a long day.

name: RMS Titanic Blend
description: Harney & Sons created RMS Titanic Blend as a tribute to the tragedy and heroism of A Night to Remember. P. H. Nargeolet, one of the divers with the French exploratory group at Woods Hole in Massachusetts when the Titanic was found, encouraged John Harney to create a commemorative tea to honor the 100th anniversary of those who perished when the Titanic sank. John created this special blend to reflect the quality of tea that was served on that voyage. It features Chinese Keemun, one of the last teas from China that the British still consumed in 1912. By then, they had mostly shifted to black teas from Assam, India, and Ceylon. The blend also includes Formosa Oolong, which was popularized in both the UK and the US by an enterprising Brit. This blend would have been recognizable to tea lovers of that era. A portion of the sales of our RMS Titanic Blend tea will go to The Ocean Conservancy, the dedicated organization committed to preserving our planet's oceans. We hope you will enjoy this tea and "remember."

name: Seven Sons Congratulating
description: This tea originated in northern Fujian Province to celebrate the highly unusual event of having seven sons. Mike only has three, so he can only imagine the joy of having four more! Once immersed in hot water, out pops a royal red flower surrounded by a ring of jasmine flowers, almost like a crown.

name: Lover's Leap
description: Mike visited this lovely estate located high above the small town of Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka. This area is among the highest areas to grow tea, and the weather is constantly changing. Sometimes sunny, but often cloudy or rainy. This makes for beautiful and lush tea plants. It does not have as distinct a growing season as the areas to the west (Dimbula) or the east (Uva). The teas from this area have a flavor of their own—light citrus notes.

name: Organic Green Tea with Organic Peppermint, Box of 20 Individually Wrapped Sachets
description:
We invite you to try our version of the traditional Arabian beverage. We blend Organic Gunpowder Green tea with aromatic Organic Peppermint leaves from Oregon to create a uniquely brisk green tea experience. 
Each box contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each sachet is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!
Click here to see all our Flavored Green Teas.

name: Holiday Herbal
description: Our Holiday Tea is popular all year. For evenings or times you'd like the flavors of citrus and holiday spices without the caffeine, try our Holiday Herbal blend. It's made with rooibos (red bush) instead of black tea and is naturally caffeine-free.

name: Jin Shan
description: One of Mike's favorite places in Zhejiang Province, China, is Jin Shan. One leaves the heat and crowds and climbs up a curvy road through the dark pines and pale bamboo trees to arrive at the ochre walls of the Jin Shan Monastery. Locals in this tiny village prepare a tea that monks have developed over centuries. Light yet flavorful, the tea is beautiful with its twists of green and white. Based upon his research, Mike believes that this area was the source of the teas that were transplanted from China to Japan, which started the long tradition of tea in Japan.

name: RMS Titanic Blend, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
Harney & Sons created RMS Titanic Blend as a tribute to the tragedy and heroism of A Night to Remember. P. H. Nargeolet, one of the divers with the French exploratory group at Woods Hole in Massachusetts when the Titanic was found, encouraged John Harney to create a commemorative tea to honor the 100th anniversary of those who perished when the Titanic sank. John created this special blend to reflect the quality of tea that was served on that voyage. It features Chinese Keemun, one of the last teas from China that the British still consumed in 1912. By then, they had mostly shifted to black teas from Assam, India, and Ceylon. The blend also includes Formosa Oolong, which was popularized in both the UK and the US by an enterprising Brit. This blend would have been recognizable to tea lovers of that era. A portion of the sales of our RMS Titanic Blend tea will go to The Ocean Conservancy, the dedicated organization committed to preserving our planet's oceans. We hope you will enjoy this tea and "remember."

We are privileged to have this tea featured in the Museum of Tea in Hangzhou, China. Harney & Sons is the only western tea company to have received this honor.

name: Pu-Erh
description: An ancient tea from Yunnan, Pu-Erh's earthy pleasures have a passionate group of followers. This particular version is a dark, savory cooked Pu-Erh and makes for a striking brew. Brigitte Harney is especially a fan. This Pu-Erh is shou style. Shou Pu-Erh is differentiated from sheng Pu-Erh in that it is fermented before it is packaged, compressed, and sold for consumption.

description: Deliciously silky and full of complex flavors, our Pomegranate Oolong tea blends large Ti Quan Yin leaves—also known as Iron Goddess of Mercy—with the tangy, sparkling flavor of pomegranate. The result is a luscious and fruit-forward brew with a toasty aroma and ample flavors of bright pomegranate. Brew it hot to enjoy its smooth, silky texture and sweet aroma at its finest.

name: Panyang Congou
description: Produced in the town of Panyang in northern Fujian Province, our Panyang Congou offers a rich, beautifully complex blend of medium-bodied teas. Named for the coiled shape of the black tea leaves, Panyang Congou represents one of the great historical teas of China. A sister tea to lighter, sweet favorites like Golden Monkey, Panyang Congou's warm, bold palate and brisk flavors make it a toasty alternative, perfect for those days when your tea needs a little oomph.

name: Organic Sencha
description: Organic Sencha is the real deal. We were happy to find a nice-tasting green tea that was truly organic and truly a Sencha. We are big fans of Matsuda and his Sencha. When we learned that this tea was from the same valley, Wazuka, we were very excited. Organic teas are very important to some tea drinkers. However, finding Japanese-produced organic teas can sometimes be challenging. Teamakers often feel that they can't make good tea without adding nitrogen. Nitrogen is present in every amino acid, including those in your body. Amino acids give Sencha their body, or umami, and they also add sweetness to the brew. However, the makers of this tea get by with natural fertilizers. Yes, the tea is a bit weaker than other Senchas, but is still very nice.

name: Organic Peppermint
description: It's great to have an organic version of Peppermint Herbal tea. Refreshing and brisk, it's one of our favorite herbals. Delicious, served hot or iced, and caffeine-free. Sourced from Oregon State.

name: Organic Bancha
description: From China, we bring you Organic Bancha green tea. It is made in the Japanese fashion of steam fixing. Light and clean-tasting.

name: Organic Assam
description: Our Organic Assam is a rich, full-leaf, medium-bodied black tea. It has a slightly lighter liquor with a sweet honey flavor.

name: Matcha iri Genmaicha
description:
Matcha is a much beloved green tea in Japan, yet it can seem intense to the uninitiated westerner. As an alternative, we suggest Matcha iri Genmaicha, the best of both worlds. The Bancha ("cha") leaves and brown rice ("genmai") that comprise Genmaicha are coated with Matcha green tea powder, and the result is fantastic!
Please brew it for 3 minutes with 175º water. The cooler water makes sure matcha does not get too strong, yet you need 3 minutes to get the nutty flavor from the genmai (brown rice). 
Make sure to check out all our Matcha teas!

name: Matsuda’s Sencha
description: Emeric visited Matsuda and his family on his recent trip to Japan. Their house is located halfway up a hill that is covered with tea bushes, and looking out over the valley, that is all one sees. The family's abode has been all business for generations. They have a space to make tea behind their home, equipped with steamers to fix green tea and rollers. This tradition and dedication serve us well because it is a unique Sencha with a distinctive aroma, great body, and flavors that are hard to forget.

name: Mango Fruit Tea
description:
Our Mango Fruit Tea blends dried mangos, hibiscus, rosehips and fruit pieces with lush natural flavors to produce a beautiful ruby red brew. It's loaded with mango flavor, without caffeine. Delicious hot or iced. Caffeine-free.
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: Mango Black
description: Add a taste of the tropics to your morning routine. This refreshingly fruity brew features a base of medium-bodied black tea blended with fresh flavors of mango and mango pieces. The result is a beautifully tropical blend, rich and silky in texture, that's perfect for chilly mornings and warm evenings alike. Enjoy hot with a touch of sweetener, if you like, or pour over ice for a refreshing summertime brew.

name: Lychee
description: Lychee is a traditional-flavored black tea from China. Brigitte Harney loves its fruity, grape-like flavors. Try it hot or iced. It's delicious and aromatic.

name: Lung Ching
description: Lung Chings are famous worldwide and are known as some of the best Chinese green teas. Our Lung Ching is made by a respected producer two hours beyond the traditional area. The small green leaves make for a brew that has a mild and sweet, almost nut-like flavor. Lung Ching teas are often in demand, so the price is dictated by the market.

name: Lung Ching, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:

name: Li Shan
description: Li Shan is known as one of the best oolong teas globally, originating from one of the highest mountainous regions in Taiwan. The tea plants endure cold temperatures, occasional snow, and frequent mists, contributing to the creation of a rare and delightful brew with hints of honey and cream. Li Shan is one of Taiwan's newer high mountain (Gao Shan) tea-growing areas, situated in the central mountain region. Special machines are used to roll the tea into balls, whereas in the past, the leaves were bent using the feet of robust workers. This tea is widely regarded as one of the finest oolongs in the world.

name: Lemony Gunpowder
description: A tongue-tantalizing blend of our traditional Gunpowder Green with a flash of brightening lemon. We've combined the sharp, charred flavors, brisk character, and robust body of Gunpowder Green with an injection of bright lemon for a rich brew that's beautifully smooth, refreshing, and awakening. Enjoy first thing in the morning to start your day off right, or sip in the afternoon when you need a pick me up.

name: Lemon Herbal
description: Lemongrass, with its lovely aroma, is the highlight of our Lemon Herbal, a light and lemony infusion. We add lemon rind and lemon flavor to make this a soothing bedtime beverage. Caffeine-free.

name: Lapsang Souchong
description: An ancient and much-loved tea from China, Lapsang, comes from the Wuyi Mountains (Wuyi Shan) in the northeastern part of Fujian Province, China. This region is where black tea was first developed (called Bohea). In the steeply forested mountains, pine trees were plentiful, so it came naturally to smoke tea like bacon. The leaves were slowly withered to create a complex tea, and then they were slowly dried in rooms with a smoky fire below. As you might imagine, the tea develops a distinctive smoky flavor. Give it a try when you want a change of pace.

The leaves were slowly withered to create a complex tea, and then they were slowly dried in rooms with a smoky fire below. As you might imagine, the tea develops a distinctive smoky flavor. Give it a try when you want a change of pace.

name: Kukicha
description: When making green tea, the Japanese ensure that nothing is wasted. The tea stalks, which might be discarded in other tea regions, have been harnessed to make a pleasant tea. Since it is made from the stems and twigs of the tea plant, there is less caffeine, amino acids, and antioxidants to give flavor and added benefits to the brew. This tea has gained an ardent following in Japan, where it is enjoyed for its mellow flavor and low caffeine levels. It is also used in macrobiotic diets.

name: Kenilworth Ceylon
description: Kenilworth is one of the oldest tea estates in Sri Lanka. Halfway up the Central Highlands, Kenilworth is considered a "medium grown" tea, so the weather there is moderate—not as hot as down in the plains, but not cool like in the peaks. Kenilworth is in the western tea area, known as "Dimbula." This estate is always a joy to visit. Unlike most tea estates, this one is neat and tidy. All of this helps to explain why the estate makes excellent full-leaf tea that is wonderfully mellow.

name: Jasmine, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Flavoring teas with jasmine flowers is an ancient Chinese tradition. The base of our Jasmine is a pouchong tea, which is slightly browner than green tea. We add fresh jasmine flowers to create a delicate and fragrant brew.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!

name: Jane's Garden Tea
description:
Gardens inspire by showing continual growth, renewal, and vitality; it also takes love, tenderness, and care to nurture a garden. It is in Jane's memory, as a lifelong friend and gardener, that Jane's Garden Tea was blended to show support during her battle against breast cancer. We are pleased to offer this rendition of green tea with pomegranate and roses, available as loose tea in our traditional black tin and also in a beautiful pink and green tin with 20 tea sachets.
One dollar ($1) of the proceeds from the sale of Jane's Garden tins will be shared by the Jane Lloyd Fund and the National Breast Cancer Foundation. This fund helps patients in Salisbury, CT, with their day-to-day expenses while battling cancer. The National Breast Cancer Foundation provides mammograms, education, and research about breast cancer nationwide.

name: Chai Hara (Green Chai)
description: We're happy to offer Chai Hara, a green tea version of our popular Chai tea. 'Hara' in Hindi means green, and ours features green tea with cardamom, cinnamon, coriander and ginger. Many enjoy this blend with milk.

name: Ceylon Vintage Silver Tips
description: Ceylon Vintage Silver Tips is a rare white tea with a flavor that's light, sweet, and sublime. A Harney & Sons exclusive, this tea is plucked and made just for us from the terminal buds of tea bushes grown high in Ceylon (Sri Lanka). They are handled with great care, so the bud remains whole and becomes silvery. Since there are no leaves, the flavor is different from traditional tea.

name: Orange Pekoe, Box of 50 Wrapped Teabags
description:
Orange Pekoe is a classic, satisfying blend of strong Assam and smooth-liquor Ceylon. A traditional staple in many households, John Harney always drank this tea whenever he needed a mellow, comforting cup. This is made from small, broken (BOP) teas in the British tradition. Also known as Ceylon & India.
Each box contains 50 teabags.Each teabag brews one 6-8 oz. cup of tea.Each teabag is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!

name: Caribe
description: Breathe in the exotic aroma of Caribe, a light fusion of green and black teas enhanced by tropical flavors. Your first sip tastes of green tea, followed by an impressive array of fruit and floral surprises. A popular favorite, enjoy it hot or iced for an afternoon escape.

name: Yerba Mate
description:
Yerba Mate is a popular herbal beverage from South America. It is a traditional drink with a long history, including being used by the Gauchos (cowboys) of Argentina. Although it is herbal, it does contain caffeine.
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.

name: Yellow & Blue
description:
Our Yellow & Blue herbal blend is a floral rapture of taste, color, and texture. It combines chamomile, lavender, and cornflowers in a tisane that is beautiful to look at and delicious to drink. Many of our fans and customers tell us they relax with this caffeine-free blend. 
10% of sales of Yellow & Blue will go to support Razom beginning April 15th, 2024. 
"Razom for Ukraine (Razom) is a leading US-based nonprofit organization dedicated to the mission of supporting a democratic and prosperous Ukraine. With a robust international network of volunteers and partners, Razom, which means “together” in Ukrainian, provides humanitarian aid and administers programs and services focused on health, advocacy, civil society, and culture."

name: Winter White Earl Grey
description: Earl Grey is a very popular tea here at Harney & Sons, so we offer many variations. They all have one thing in common: the wonderful lemony aromas and flavors that come from our oil of bergamot. It is the base that makes them different. Winter White uses Mutan White, making it lighter than traditional black teas. It has as its base the vegetal and, oh, so lightly fruity flavors of Mutan White Tea. If you want something lighter than traditional Earl Grey, this is a great choice.

name: White Vanilla Grapefruit
description: We came up with this wonderful blend over a decade ago. We loved the combination of flavors against the subtle backdrop of the white tea. No exciting name came to our heads, so we called it what it was: white, vanilla, and grapefruit. People find that the tea is a pleasant surprise, and it is better than anticipated. Please give this tea a try. We all need pleasant surprises!

name: Winter White Earl Grey, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:

name: White Peach
description: Subtle and refined, our White Peach tea delivers a delicate, sweet palate full of scrumptious flavors. We begin with subtle, hand-picked Chinese  Mutan White tea, full of light vegetal flavors, and augment its smooth and welcoming palate with sweet notes of peach for a body that's strong without being brash. Finally, an even-handed touch of natural vanilla swirls through, bringing this reliably enjoyable brew to a close.

name: White Christmas
description: Recline in front of a glowing fire while the snow drifts and the tree lights twinkle. A sip from this warm and nutty blend completes the perfect winter wonderland.

name: Wenshan Baozhong
description: This is a lovely tea made by the Cheng family, which has been making Pouchongs for over 100 years. Visiting this tea's hometown is the highlight of any trip to Taiwan. PingLing is a true tea town, with tea restaurants, a tea museum, statues of hardworking pluckers, and even streetlights that resemble teapots. A beautiful natural preserve, abundant with gardenia flowers, surrounds it. This year was no exception. When we buy Wenshan Baozhong tea, we look for something that reminds us of gardenias: lovely, lilting floral notes in the aroma and a good body. It is always a joy to drink!

name: Wedding Tea
description: We created Wedding Tea as an elegant blend for your momentous event. It features Mutan White tea with lemon-vanilla to taste, with a touch of pink rosebuds and petals. Caffeinated. Our loose tea, or Bag of 50 tea sachets, is ideal for serving a large number of guests at parties and receptions.   We offer Wedding Tea Tagalongs in two options: Each version contains five tea sachets in a blue tin. Each sachet brews a 12 oz cup of tea. You may purchase them with the standard Wedding Tea tin design or choose Wedding Tea Personalized Tagalongs featuring the couple's names. These make a lovely wedding reception favor or special gift.   Please note: Allow two weeks for processing and shipping for all Wedding Tea Personalized Tagalongs. We may get them to you sooner, but we regret that we cannot guarantee a faster turnaround. The tins will come as shown in this photo, with the script font as shown. Please write what you would like to say in the "Gift Message" section of your order. If you need assistance, please call 1-800-TEA-TIME, Monday-Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. EST, prior to placing your custom order.

name: Wedding Tea, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
We created Wedding Tea as an elegant blend for your momentous event. It features Mutan White tea with lemon-vanilla to taste, with a touch of pink rosebuds and petals. Caffeinated. Our Bag of 50 tea sachets is ideal for serving a large number of guest at parties and receptions. 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Wedding Tea.

name: Viennese Earl Grey
description: Viennese Earl Grey is a graceful variation inspired by our friend Andrew Demmer's Teehaus in Vienna. It has a Darjeeling base, so it is lighter than other Earl Grey versions. You'll still notice and enjoy the lovely lemony notes from the bergamot.

name: Verveine (Lemon Verbena)
description: We source only the best Verveine, also known as Lemon Verbena. The big green leaves produce an unusually good body for an herbal brew with a wonderful lemon yellow color and aroma. Please use 4 to 5 leaves per 8 ounces of water.

name: Vanilla Black
description: A natural sweetness and rich flavor make Vanilla Black tea an irresistible delight. Its aroma awakens memories of baking sugar cookies with your grandmother. This tea is also available without caffeine, so you can enjoy it anytime, day or night. For the caffeine-free version, please see Decaf Vanilla Comoro.

name: Uva Highlands
description: Uva Highlands is a lovely high-grown Ceylon Pekoe from Uva, with small leaves that produce an intense tea. It is bright and brisk, with a minty spice note guaranteed to pick you up on dull afternoons. It can handle milk and sugar with aplomb.

name: Tropical Green
description: To create Tropical Green, we've combined some of our finest hand-picked green teas from China into a beautiful mélange with a smooth palate, bright aromas, and vibrant pineapple character. A superb tropical twist on traditional green tea that is equally suited to satisfy old cravings and new indulgences alike. Enjoy it fresh-steeped and hot as a complement to breakfast, or savor it as an icy treat in the summertime.

name: Tropical Green, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
To create Tropical Green, we've combined some of our finest hand-picked green teas from China into a beautiful mélange with a smooth palate, bright aromas, and vibrant pineapple character. Enjoy it fresh-steeped and hot as a complement to breakfast, or savor it as an icy treat in the summertime.

Click here to see additional purchasing options for Tropical Green.

name: Tower of London
description:
Tower of London Blend is reminiscent of Elizabethan preserves, flavorful, and tempting. We stir Chinese black teas with pieces of dried stone fruit, then finish the blend with oil of bergamot and honey flavor. Featured in our Historic Royal Palaces Collection, it has become one of our most popular teas, especially with its brilliant amethyst-inspired tin.
Historic Royal Palaces is an independent charity that looks after the Tower of London, Hampton Court Palace, the Banqueting House, Kensington Palace, and Hillsborough Castle and Gardens.

name: Tropical Green, Box of 20 Premium Teabags
description:
To create Tropical Green, we've combined some of our finest hand-picked green teas from China into a beautiful mélange with a smooth palate, bright aromas, and vibrant pineapple character. name: Tokyo
description: Inspired by the impeccable desserts offered in Japan's stunning capital city, Tokyo is a delightful green tea blend. We began with sencha and added savory flavors of toasted sesame seeds and a swirl of sweet caramel. The result is a smooth and refreshing brew that's just desserty enough to be indulgent in the best way. Especially delicious, it is enjoyed plain so that the dual flavors of sesame and caramel can shine.

name: Tippy Yunnan
description: Yunnan is the birthplace of tea. The big black leaves of Tippy Yunnan have a touch of gold, and it brews up medium-bodied and round. It has a good balance of sweet and earthy notes, with none of the smokiness that overpowers other Yunnans.

name: Thai Rooibos
description: Thai Rooibos is our spicy blend of caffeine-free herbs and spices, including Rooibos (of course) with cinnamon, ginger, coconut, and lemongrass. This earthy blend is quite lively, highlighting citrus and fruity flavors with exotic aromas of coconut and ginger.

name: Tencha
description: We are pleased to bring you this special offering, as Tencha is rare to find for sale, even inside Japan. Tencha is the base green tea for making powdered Matcha. Dark in color yet light in the cup, this tea has a lot of body (or umami) and no roast flavors.

name: Temi Sikkim
description: The only tea we offer from Sikkim, the cup brews nicely and has a stone fruit quality to it. The leaves that make up our Temi Sikkim give it a smooth honey finish, making it perfect for your afternoon brew.

name: Strawberry Kiwi Fruit Tea
description:
For beautiful Strawberry Kiwi Fruit Tea, we blend strawberries and dried fruit pieces with strawberry and kiwi flavors to create a vibrant ruby-red drink. It looks festive when brewed in a glass teapot and tastes delicious hot or iced. Caffeine-free.
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: Strawberry Kiwi Fruit Tea, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
For beautiful Strawberry Kiwi Fruit Tea, we blend strawberries and dried fruit pieces with strawberry and kiwi flavors to create a vibrant ruby-red drink. It looks festive when brewed in a glass teapot and tastes delicious hot or iced. Caffeine-free. 
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Strawberry Kiwi Fruit Tea.

name: Spiced Plum Herbal
description: Spiced Plum is an herbal infusion with the delightful essence of cinnamon and plums. Heartier than most herbals, this one has a presence that will surprise you. Caffeine-free.

name: SoHo Blend
description: In November 2015, our SoHo flagship store celebrated its fifth year at 433 Broome Street! Emeric Harney, our marketing director, created this beautiful black tea blend to celebrate the store's grand opening back in 2010. Now a landmark favorite, SoHo Blend is an irresistible cup that is sure not to disappoint!

name: SoHo Blend, Tin of 20 Sachets
description:
In November 2015, our SoHo flagship store celebrated its fifth year at 433 Broome Street! Emeric Harney, our marketing director, created this beautiful black tea blend to celebrate the store's grand opening back in 2010. Now a landmark favorite, SoHo Blend is an irresistible cup that is sure not to disappoint! 
Each tin contains 20 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Be sure to recycle your tin, or click here to explore ways to reuse your tins!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for SoHo Blend.

name: Soba Roasted Buckwheat
description: Soba Roasted Buckwheat is a traditional Japanese specialty that is prepared as you would an herbal tisane. It is naturally caffeine-free, with a delightful toasty flavor and nutty undertones. It was always Brigitte Harney's favorite on our visits to the former Takashimaya on Fifth Avenue, NY, where we supplied tea for their renowned tea room over many years. We've since found a fine source and are pleased to continue offering it. This Soba tea can be eaten and cooked with!

name: Japanese Sencha
description: We call this tea Japanese Sencha because not all Sencha on the market are from Japan. Our Sencha is a very fine one from the central Shizuoka province and can be found in many homes in Tokyo. It is a pleasant and approachable green tea, a fine choice for everyday, in the way our founder, John Harney, always began his mornings with this cup.

name: Sencha Scent of Mountains
description: This Japanese green tea is a hit! The Otsuka family, who supply several Japanese green teas to us, did a great job with this Sencha. Sencha Scent of Mountains originates from Kawane, the highest tea region within the vast Shizuoka tea region. Although not as high as Darjeeling or Uva, it is high for Japanese tea gardens. The cooler air contributes to the delightful aroma. The body of this Sencha is lighter than other Senchas due to its lack of deep steaming. People love the delicious light vegetal taste and distinctive aromas. This brew remains one of the most popular teas at our SoHo flagship store.

name: Sally's Secret
description: Sally's Secret is our celebration of life, love, and fine tea. We present this aromatic blend in memory of our co-worker Sally, whose expert blending, steady friendship, and love of all things pink we miss each day. Enjoy a cup of this lovely blend of our Earl Grey and pink rosebuds with a friend.

name: Royal Wedding Tea
description: Royal Wedding is a remarkable blend of Chinese  Mutan White tea buds with almond, coconut, and vanilla, and an abundance of pink rosebuds and petals. It is indeed a regal tea to celebrate a glorious occasion.

name: Peaches & Ginger
description: Enjoy Peaches & Ginger, a popular addition to our selection of flavored black teas. This blend combines the irresistible flavors of fresh peaches with the 'zing' of ginger. Enjoy it hot or iced. This tea is also available without caffeine, so you can enjoy it anytime, day or night. For the caffeine-free version, please see Decaf Peaches & Ginger.

name: Peach Fruit Tea
description:
When you're craving the summertime breeze, try our Peach Fruit Tea. We blend fruit pieces with rosehips, hibiscus, and natural flavors to produce a beautiful, vibrant ruby red drink. The peach flavor is a pure delight for this caffeine-free brew, which is delicious served hot or iced. 
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: Paris
description: Mike Harney has enjoyed many a pot of tea in the famous Parisian tea shops. In homage to the city, he created what's become one of Harney & Sons' most popular and beloved blends worldwide. Paris is a fruity black tea with vanilla and caramel flavors and a hint of lemony bergamot. The aroma is delightful!

name: Passion Fruit
description:
When you can't venture to the islands, brew a cup of fruity tea! Passion Fruit is full of bright flavors with a black tea base. Thanks to this blend, we're transported to a tropical state of mind. It is delicious for a warm cup or iced tea infusion.

Please note: The Box of 50 pouches makes double the amount of tea. Each pouch yields 1 gallon.

name: Organic Green with Citrus & Ginkgo, Box of 20 Premium Teabags
description:
Based on a hand-picked organic green tea from China, our refreshing Organic Green with Citrus & Ginkgo blend delivers the benefits associated with green tea and ginkgo. It features a dash of lemongrass and the bright taste of natural citrus.
Each box contains 20 teabags.Each teabag brews one 6-8 oz. cup of tea.Each teabag is individually wrapped, making it perfect for travel or sharing with a friend!
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Organic Green with Citrus & Ginkgo.

name: Organic Earl Grey
description: Our Organic Earl Grey is a nice blend of Assam from the northern bank of the Brahmaputra River and Korakundah, located in southern India, with natural oil of bergamot. Since both are organic teas, the aroma is light and subtle, allowing the lemony bergamot to be more pronounced. A perfect and popular afternoon tea, you'll find it round and rich.

name: Organic Darjeeling
description: A single-estate Darjeeling that varies from year to year depending on which producer offers the highest quality tea. While the body can be light, the aromas and flavors of bright red fruits and the sweetness of stone fruits reign supreme.

name: Orange Passion Fruit Tea
description:
For Orange Passion Fruit Tea, we blend rosehips, hibiscus, dried oranges, and other fruit pieces with orange and tropical passion fruit flavors. This combination produces a brilliant ruby-red brew loaded with great flavor and no caffeine. Rich and flavorful, it's delicious and vibrant, hot or iced! Caffeine-free.
Click here to see our Fruit Tea Collection.

name: New Vithanakande
description: The taste of New Vithanakande is very "round" and satisfying—a wonderful tea for afternoon enjoyment. We love the look of the black leaf with a gold streak running through it.

name: Mutan White
description: The Da Bei (Big White) cultivar produces Mutan White on the same hills as Chinese Silver Needle. In fact, Mutan White is typically harvested shortly after the harvest of Chinese Silver Needle, also known as YinZhen, which is located just outside of Fuan in northern Fujian Province. Once enough tips or buds are gathered to produce Chinese Silver Needle, the plants are allowed to continue growing. Then, when two immature leaves have grown, the whole set is harvested: two leaves and a bud (aka tip). The sets are dried in large barns, where the slow process allows a bit of oxidation to occur. This gives Mutan White some fruity and vegetal flavors. Although the leaves look green, this is a white tea because of the production method.

name: Mint Verbena
description: Our Mint Verbena is an invigorating herbal that combines two favorites: Caffeine-free mint and Lemon Verbena. Mint is also known to calm a temperamental stomach.

name: Indian Nimbu
description: Nimbu is Hindi for "lemon," and that, together with caramel flavor, is what we added to a fine Darjeeling to get this wonderful tea. Light and delicious, it features a citrus aroma and is slightly sweet.

name: Ichiban Sencha
description: Emeric visited the Otsuka family in the spring of 2023. The Otsuka family has been making tea in the coastal region of Kakegawa for almost 150 years. This Ichiban is their pride, made from the tea fields that surround their factory. The area is so dominated by tea that one hill has a tea bush topiary trimmed to the shape of the Japanese character for "tea." Ichiban is harvested on the first days of production in late April. It is made at an old, traditional factory and then finished at their plant. Compared to the polished and almost pastoral quality of Matsuda's Sencha, this Ichiban has the punch and intensity of Tokyo's rush hour.

name: Hot Cinnamon Spice
description:
Our most popular flavored tea worldwide, Hot Cinnamon Spice, is an assertive blend of black teas, three types of cinnamon, orange peel, and sweet cloves, with no sugar added. This tea is also known as Hot Cinnamon Sunset. They are the same tea. The name varies only in certain packaging.
Looking to try something new? Check out all our Cinnamon Spiced Teas.

name: Holiday Tea
description: Holiday Tea, spiced with citrus, almond, clove, and cinnamon, has become a year-round favorite black tea. Delicious hot or iced, it's a wonderful addition to a holiday table, served piping hot on a cold winter morning, or anytime you crave a holiday-inspired brew.

name: Holiday Tea, Bag of 50 Sachets

name: Hojicha
description: Hojicha is another creative use of tea by-products by the Japanese. Hojicha was commercialized once mechanical harvesters started being used in Japan to compensate for labor shortages. The tea plant was shorn of everything, and the mess was separated later. The best leaves became Sencha, the larger leaves became Yanagi, and the stems became Hojicha. Tea terms in Japan have several meanings, and hojicha can mean several types of tea. For us, it is roasted twigs.

name: Herbal Hot Cinnamon Spice
description:
We suggest Herbal Hot Cinnamon Spice for those of you who wish to reduce caffeine yet still enjoy the unmistakable Hot Cinnamon Spice flavors you love. For this version, we add three types of cinnamon to African Organic Rooibos (red bush), creating a delicious herbal tisane that's naturally caffeine-free. Some of you ask if we add sugar or sweeteners to this tea; we assure you that we do not. The sweetness comes from the cinnamon. Enjoy it hot or iced!
Looking to try something new? ﻿Check out all our Cinnamon Spiced Teas.

name: Hao Ya 'B'
description: Keemuns are some of China's most renowned black teas since the British acquired a love for them. The teas come from the rolling hills in southeastern Anhui Province, China. After the MaoFeng is finished around the beginning of May, the Hao Yas are made. Hao Yas are separated. The best tips become Hao Ya 'A,' and the next best tips become Hao Ya 'B.'

name: Hao Ya 'A'
description: Keemuns are some of China's most renowned black teas, ever since the British acquired a love for them. The teas come from the rolling hills in southeastern Anhui Province, China. After the MaoFeng is finished around the beginning of May, the Hao Yas are made. Hao Yas are separated; the best tips become Hao Ya 'A,' and the next best tips become Hao Ya 'B.'

name: Gyokuro
description: Gyokuro, a centuries-old favorite of Japanese aristocrats, is one of Japan's finest tea offerings, as well as the most famous of Uji's teas. This highly esteemed emerald tea is shade-grown for approximately three weeks, producing an infusion of the beautiful pale green color from which it gets its name after harvest. For the initial infusion, steep with gently heated water and enjoy the exquisite, sweet flavors and aromas of Uji's finest tea.

name: Guayusa
description:
Guayusa is a traditional Ecuadorian beverage from the Amazon. Like Yerba Mate, it contains elevated levels of caffeine and many antioxidants. It has a mild vegetable flavor. Only recently has it been introduced to the States.
Click here to see all our herbs native to the Americas.

name: Green Hot Cinnamon Spice
description:
We're pleased to offer Green Hot Cinnamon Spice, our green tea version of our popular Hot Cinnamon Spice! We begin with Chinese green teas, then add three types of cinnamon, sweet clove, and orange peel. The result is lighter in body than the original black tea, yet it retains all the bracing hot cinnamon flavors everyone loves. Customers sometimes think we add sugar or sweeteners to this tea, yet we do not. The sweetness comes from the cinnamon. Enjoy!
Looking to try something new? Check out all our Cinnamon Spiced Teas.

name: Ginger's Oolong
description: When we added ginger to our peachy and delicious Formosa Oolong, we couldn't believe our tastebuds. Ginger's Oolong, a fun and flavorful spin on our popular Peaches & Ginger tea, was created!

name: Ginger Liquorice
description: Sometimes simplicity is best. Our Ginger Liquorice is a no-fuss infusion that exudes the pure quality of its ingredients and enjoyably drinkable flavors. Spicy, fair-bodied ginger and sweet notes of soothing liquorice play against one another for a simple yet elegant palate. Caffeine-free and full of delightful flavors, this brew makes a wonderful cleanser after a long day or a post-lunch soother.

name: Genmaicha
description: Genmaicha is a different kind of Japanese green tea that many people find intriguing. Brown rice kernels (genmai) are added while the green Bancha leaves (cha) are being dried, so the kernels get crispy and some burst open. Genmaicha has a unique appearance and a pleasant roasted flavor.

name: Fruits d'Alsace
description: Inspired by the delicious Alsatian cuisine of Chef Jean Joho, this is a dessert tea with the flavors of the tree fruits from that region of France: apricots, cherries, and plums.

name: French Super Blue Lavender
description: Our French Super Blue Lavender, a traditional herbal sourced from the perfume capital of the French Riviera, has a deep blue hue, an intense floral taste, and a captivating aroma. Brigitte, Mike's French wife, treasures its special qualities. If you also love lavender, this is the perfect tisane for you.

name: Formosa Oolong
description: Formosa Oolong is the style of brown oolong that generations of Americans have loved, especially for its toasty flavor. Don't worry about the stems; the tea is traditionally made this way in Taiwan.

name: Formosa Oolong, Bag of 50 Sachets
description:
Formosa Oolong is the style of brown oolong that generations of Americans have loved, especially for its toasty flavor. Don't worry about the stems; the tea is traditionally made this way in Taiwan.
Each bag contains 50 tea sachets.Each sachet brews one 12 oz. cup of tea.Each bag is resealable to keep your tea fresh!
 
Click here to see additional purchasing options for Formosa Oolong.

name: Fanciest Formosa Oolong
description: This tea is made in Northern Taiwan and is twisted (as opposed to the balled style). It is harvested around June, which is later than other oolongs. The growers allow a leaf hopper (Jacobiasca formosana) to attack the tea leaves. The plants release a compound in self-defense that we find deliciously similar in flavor to peaches. Mike saw the plants on the defensive on a trip to Taiwan; he found it fascinating to observe this remarkable botanical process.

name: English Breakfast
description: There are many versions of English Breakfast tea. Ours has an ancient pedigree. Researchers have traced its heritage back to the black tea the English drank regularly in the 1800's. It is, simply, China black 100% Keemun. A simple way to start your hectic day!
